programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: A formidable foe means Walker's karate skills are put into practice

programme.title: The Six Million Dollar Man
programme.desc: A temporarily blind Steve Austin finds himself in a plane whose pilot has collapsed at the controls. Pat Hingle guest stars

programme.title: Star Trek: Deep Space Nine
programme.desc: Cdr Riker's duplicate steals the Defiant and makes an attack on Cardassian territory, in an effort to help the Maquis. Guest starring Jonathan Frakes

programme.title: George and the Dragon (2004)
programme.desc: A knight returns from the Crusades looking forward to a quiet life, but finds himself embarking on a new mission when the king's daughter disappears. He sets out to find the missing princess - in return for some land of his own - but his quest leads to a confrontation with a fearsome dragon. Fantasy adventure, with James Purefoy, Piper Perabo, Simon Callow, Patrick Swayze and Michael Clarke Duncan

programme.title: Legend Lowdown
programme.desc: Take a look at all the latest movies and series coming your way this month

programme.title: Robot Overlords (2014)
programme.desc: In a world controlled by a robots, the human population is constantly monitored and is unable to venture outside. However, a boy manages to turn off his personal surveillance device, enabling him to begin a search for his long-lost father, who may hold the key to saving humanity. Family sci-fi adventure, starring Ben Kingsley, Gillian Anderson and Callan McAuliffe

programme.title: Legend Lowdown
programme.desc: Take a look at all the latest movies and series coming your way this month

programme.title: Descent (2005)
programme.desc: When volcanic activity in the Pacific reaches unprecedented levels, a team of scientists is recruited by the US government to avert a catastrophe. However, one of the group realises that his new employers may be responsible for the looming disaster. Sci-fi drama, starring Luke Perry, Natalie Brown and Michael Dorn

programme.title: Legend Lowdown
programme.desc: Take a look at all the latest movies and series coming your way this month

programme.title: Star Trek
programme.desc: Kirk runs into an old enemy who killed his friend years ago and decides to have one more shot at defeating the vampire-like creature. Sci-fi adventure, starring William Shatner

programme.title: Star Trek: Deep Space Nine
programme.desc: Ambassador Lwaxana Troi visits the station hoping to renew her relationship with Odo, and an inexplicable outbreak of lust and romance coincides with a Bajoran celebration. Guest starring Majel Barrett

programme.title: The Six Million Dollar Man
programme.desc: Steve escorts a dying prime minister to a secret hospital for the first bionic heart transplant

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: A white supremacist group take Alex and the employees of a TV station hostage, as revenge for Walker and Trivette arresting their leader

programme.title: The Hatton Garden Job (2017)
programme.desc: A ragtag group of career criminals plot an audacious, multi-million-pound raid on an underground facility in London. True-life crime drama, with Stephen Moyer, Larry Lamb and Matthew Goode

programme.title: The Flock (2007)
programme.desc: A paranoid federal agent placed in charge of monitoring sex offenders is forced to take early retirement when he becomes violent with the men he is supposed to be keeping an eye on. His final duty before leaving is to train his successor, who he instead recruits into helping him with his obsessive quest to find a missing girl. Crime thriller, starring Richard Gere and Claire Danes

programme.title: Videodrome (1982)
programme.desc: A sleazy TV producer investigates a violent pirate broadcast that may be a real snuff movie. In the process, he uncovers a sinister plot to turn the public into brainless drones through their televisions. David Cronenberg's surreal horror, starring James Woods, Sonja Smits, Deborah Harry and Peter Dvorsky

programme.title: Bloodthirsty (2020)
programme.desc: When a singer teams up with a producer at his remote studio, she discovers a horrific secret lurking within the walls - and her music isn't the only thing transforming. Lycanthropic horror, starring Lauren Beatty, Greg Bryk and Katharine King So

programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present the magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Ian's business lunch with Suki and Nish doesn't go to plan and Peter tries to make amends with Gina and Anna. Sonia and Reiss head to their first fertility appointment and Freddie is consumed by guilt

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Steve Fletcher works on a mantle clock in the shape of a ship, a treasured gift from the owner's late grandfather. Kirsten Ramsay is called upon to painstakingly piece together a vintage ceramic night light, fractured into dozens of fragments, and skateboard enthusiast Mike is hoping Will Kirk and Dominic Chinea can restore his wooden board, which transports him back to his youth in 1960s Liverpool. Finally, toy restorers Julie and Amanda undertake the repair of a treasured teddy bear that has been by the side of a young man as he's undergone life-changing surgery

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The four remaining chefs must create a theatrical showstopping dish which will decide who makes it to the next challenge. The final three then face the Chef's Table hosted by Robin Gill. The finalists must deliver exceptional food to a table of professional restaurateurs including Raymond Blanc, Daniel Clifford, Anna Haugh, Nieves Barragan Mohacho and Matt Gillan

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: BBC London News; Weather
programme.desc: The latest updates from the region

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: The North West Ambulance Service is alerted about a possible outbreak of the highly infectious Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS) at Fairfield General Hospital in Bury. Senior paramedic Claire is dispatched to liaise between the hospital and the ambulance service, while the Hazardous Area Response Team prepare to transport the patient to North Manchester General Hospital's Infectious Disease Unit

programme.title: If Beale Street Could Talk (2018)
programme.desc: In early 1970s Harlem, 19-year old Tish Rivers recalls the longtime relationship between her and fianc Alonzo 'Fonny' Hunt. With a child on the way, their plans of starting a family and embracing the future are derailed when Fonny is arrested for a crime he did not commit. Director Barry Jenkins' Oscar-winning drama, starring KiKi Layne and Stephan James

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: It's a busy night in Newcastle for Northumbria Police as they work the night-time economy shift, while the National Police Air Service face danger in the skies. Plus, a look at one of the most dangerous specialties in the police - firearms

programme.title: Expert Witness
programme.desc: Evidence unearthed by a forensic archaeologist helps to catch the killer of a young woman from Wiltshire, and a case of harrowing neglect suffered by a Welsh teenager is revealed by an insect expert

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and the team explore properties in West Bromwich, Gawthorpe, Wakefield and Lowestoft, sold at online auctions by developers who have plans to make money

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Roo Irvine presents from an antiques fair in Detling, Kent, where experts Irita Marriott and Nick Hall advise the red and blue teams as they shop for antiques to sell at auction. Meanwhile, Roo takes a look back at the history of crime and punishment

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC London News; Weather
programme.desc: The latest updates from the region

programme.title: Five Bedrooms
programme.desc: A half-baked plan to become Manju's carer post-surgery proves to be Liz's undoing, when it leads to Stuart finding out about past indiscretions. Australian comedy drama, starring Kat Stewart, Stephen Peacocke, Doris Younane, Katie Robertson and Roy Joseph

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph heads to Walsall Recycling Centre, where she rescues a hand-made sideboard and a pair of solid wood bedside tables with the help of screenprint artist Daniel Heath

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson crosses the Solent to property shop on the Isle of Wight with a couple who have a 750,000 budget to find their dream island home with holiday-let potential. During his journey, the presenter also gets an intimate glimpse into 19th-century royal life when he visits Osbourne House, one of Queen Victoria's favourite homes

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Lee Burkhill are in Fareham to create a relaxing garden for Lisa, Mike and their two boys that will suit the whole family and be inspired by their travels

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host the quiz in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win 5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Konnie Huq joins Alexander Armstrong to co-host the quiz in which four pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: BBC London News; Weather
programme.desc: The latest updates from the region

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Lauren Laverne round off the working week with another mix of live chat and topical reports

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: In 1987, after devastating winter storms and a change in fisheries laws, the vibrant kelp forests off the Sussex coast were largely reduced to a barren desert. This documentary follows the efforts of 74-year-old free diver Eric Smith to restore and then protect the area after his lobbying of the Sussex Inshore Fisheries and Conservation Authority helped initiate a landmark plan to ban trawling in Sussex and allow the seabed to recover

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: A look back at some of the best bits from the past 12 months of the show, with a host of sports stars joining question-master Paddy McGuinness and team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek on the entertaining sports quiz

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Singer Sophie Ellis-Bextor, actress Briony May Williams and comedians Loyiso Gola and Jason Manford join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: Twenty famous faces started the battle to become Celebrity MasterChef Champion 2023 and now only three remain.The finalists must now cook and present a faultless three-course meal in two hours for judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace, their last chance to prove they have what it takes by showing true passion and creativity with their dishes before one of them is declared the winner

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Agnes is feeling down in the dumps. The house is a mess, she can't seem to get any sleep and - to make things worse - Maria's home remedies end in disaster. Will the family show her some much-needed and long overdue appreciation? Return of the comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll

programme.desc: The latest updates from the region

programme.title: Starstruck
programme.desc: Jessie and Tom reconnect, but after accepting his invitation to see him backstage at a West End show, she has to decide if pursuing an old flame is a good idea. She finds herself face to face with his new partner, and on the receiving end of a harsh grilling from his agent. John Simm joins the cast of the comedy

programme.title: Starstruck
programme.desc: Jessie and her friends enjoy a weekend in the countryside, but tension rises in the group when Ian blurts out a secret that Jessie would rather not have heard. Steve proposes a game to bring the friends back together - but is it enough to cover the cracks?

programme.title: Relic (2020)
programme.desc: Three generations of the same family are haunted by a presence which is taking over a woman's mind. Mystery horror, starring Emily Mortimer, Robyn Nevin and Bella Heathcote

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Denise Nurse helps a couple to find a new home closer to their son in Northumbria, and also pays a visit to the Northumberland National Park

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Chris Hull head to Shropshire to convert Denise and John's simple and inaccessible garden into a wheelchair friendly Italian-inspired outdoor space with a 6,000 budget

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: Lara Scott shows viewers around Norfolk Deaf Festival, an annual event that brings the local deaf community together. Deaf yoga teacher Sarah Scott gives Yvonne and Julian a few wellness techniques and reveals how people can access their local yoga class, and there's a tribute to Sinead O'Connor, who famously produced a signed song

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo heads to Northern Ireland's spectacular Causeway coast to begin a new journey, which takes him along the north and east coasts through Ulster and Leinster. He begins in Co Derry on the windswept shores of Loch Foyle, where the largest accumulation of coastal sands in Ireland has formed a system of dunes visible from space. He also learns how scientists are monitoring the site and hears how their work has been picked up by fellow scientists in the United States to help research the surface of Mars

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family
programme.desc: Sasha Wass and Jeremy Dein investigate the mysterious murder of a Yorkshire farm owner in 1933, finding out if a clandestine love affair may have led to a brutal killing

programme.title: The Wonder of Animals
programme.desc: Chris Packham learns how foxes have been able to adapt and thrive in a world with an ever-increasing human population. New research reveals how the animals' split pupils enable them to hunt in the bright desert day, and the presenter discusses a theory that the creatures use the Earth's magnetic field to determine the location of their prey

programme.title: Back in Time for the Factory
programme.desc: Time moves on for the volunteers from 1973 to 1976, when disco was dominating the dance floors and maxi dresses were in vogue. It was also a time of great hope for women, with the Sex Discrimination Act having just been passed and the Equal Pay Act now in force. But will the changes in the law lead to equality on the factory floor or will the workers' hopes be dashed once again?

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey from Northern Ireland across the water to Scotland. Leaving from the seaport of Larne, he reaches Stranraer and the Mull of Galloway, where in a lighthouse built by railway engineer Robert Stevenson he discovers a magnificent machine, installed at the turn of the 20th century

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: A collection of finds from various locations around the country, including Lulworth Castle in Dorset, Chiddingstone Castle in Kent and Wrest Park, Bedfordshire

programme.title: Live International T20 Cricket
programme.desc: England v Sri Lanka. Isa Guha presents live coverage of the third and final match in the series from The Incora County Ground, Derby. England's side will be buoyant, having won two of the three T20s they played against Australia in the recent Ashes series, which included a memorable victory at Lord's. They now face a Sri Lanka side they last met prior to this series at the 2022 Commonwealth Games in Birmingham. That encounter ended in a victory for the home side, meaning they went into these contests with a 100 per cent record in T20s against the Sri Lankans, with nine wins from nine

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: In the first of two special episodes commemorating the end of the long-running topical comedy series, a chance to see again some of the finest moments from the first half of its 17-year history

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Surviving 9/11
programme.desc: The stories of 13 people caught up in the events of September 11, 2001, moving between accounts of the two-hour period when terrorists attacked the Twin Towers and the Pentagon and hijacked Flight 93 and what has happened in the 20 years since. The film examines what was it like to actually live through such a historic event and how easy it was to move on from a day that society wants to go on remembering

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: Lara Scott shows viewers around Norfolk Deaf Festival, an annual event that brings the local deaf community together. Deaf yoga teacher Sarah Scott gives Yvonne and Julian a few wellness techniques and reveals how people can access their local yoga class, and there's a tribute to Sinead O'Connor, who famously produced a signed song

programme.title: Ultimate Wedding Planner
programme.desc: Sparks fly as the contenders clash over plans for a multi-themed wedding, and with two venues to arrange it turns out to be the toughest challenge yet. Can they pull together and impress judges Sara Davies, Fred Sirieix and Raj Somaiya?

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie and Flo go head-to-head to design a garden to match Jo and Jack's Victorian terraced house. They have just 4,500 to tick all the boxes on the couple's extensive wishlist

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The last of the semi-final contests sees the celebrities asked to cook the ultimate airline food to celebrate the golden age of travel. Each must create a main course, a side dish and a dessert that will be served in first class style. The celebrities' meal is key to staying on course for the ultimate stage of the competition as at the end of this edition, only the five best cooks will go through to Finals Week. Presented by Gregg Wallace and John Torode

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell meet the new owners of some terraces in Durham and Beddau and a majestic looking period semi-detached in Crewe to hear about their renovation plans

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Experts transform and then sell three things about to be dumped at a tip, before giving the profits to the people who were getting rid of the items

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don reveals how to take cuttings from herbs and prunes summer raspberries. He also plants daylilies and gives topiary Nigel a timely trim. Adam Frost travels to Whitstable on the Kent coast to see how gardeners cope with the wild, wet, and windy weather

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Politics UK
programme.desc: The week's political proceedings around the UK

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family
programme.desc: Jeremy Dein and Sasha Wass investigate a notorious arsenic poisoning in which a distinguished lawyer and Army veteran hanged for the murder of his wife

programme.title: The Wonder of Animals
programme.desc: Chris Packham explores how the brain of the great ape has evolved, revealing that different areas have been adapted over time by the animal's anatomy, ingenuity and sociability. He also examines how the ability to use two hands asymmetrically sets the great apes apart from other tool-using animals, and how social living is linked to the evolution of the amygdala in both apes and humans

programme.title: Back in Time for the Factory
programme.desc: Over the past four weeks, 18 volunteers have experienced what life was like for the factory girls of the south Wales valleys in the 1960s, 1970s and 1980s. Now some of the women who lived through it for real talk about their lives, speaking of terrifying bosses, everyday sexism, union battles, camaraderie and of lifelong friendships forged on the production line. Presented by Alex Jones, who also reveals how the factory was brought back to life using these women's stories as inspiration

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo falls into line with the University of Glasgow's Officer Training Corps, where he joins students for drill. The political pundit then heads west along the Firth of Clyde to Helensburgh, where he discovers a pioneering group of artists known as the Glasgow Boys. The idyllic West Highland Line takes Michael deep into the Highlands to Inveraray and the ancestral home of the Clan Campbell and Dukes of Argyll. Michael's final stop is Connel Ferry, near Oban, where, on the Achnacloich Estate, he discovers a Highland calf whose breed has become an icon of the Highlands

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: At St Albans Cathedral and Abbey, Hertfordshire, Claire Rawle discovers an arts and crafts bowl that may have belonged to George Bernard Shaw's wife, and Jonathan Pratt finds a drawing by the artist Laura Knight. Presenter Paul Martin heads underground as he explores Royston Cave, which boasts medieval carvings

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Jen Brister, Kelvin Fletcher, Ian Moore and Zoe Williams test their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Marcus Wareing's Tales from a Kitchen Garden
programme.desc: The chef is thinking of expanding his herd, so he visits the nearby Buckhurst estate to learn about traditional Sussex cattle. Marcus also learns about pond management, and investigates how to encourage more wildlife onto the farm

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: The Memorial Van Damme. All the action from the 13th and penultimate meeting of the campaign, held at King Baudouin Stadium in Belgium. Jake Wightman was the sole British winner here last year in the 800m, but he has been ruled out of the current season due to a foot injury. There was also a fine win for Ireland's Ciara Mageean here in 2022, claiming victory in the 1500m in a national record of 3:56.63

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants bulbs in pots, including hyacinths and daffodils. He shares tips and advice on what to do when apples and pears have been affected by diseases such as canker and brown rot. Toby Buckland discovers an eco-home in Rye which has been cleverly designed to incorporate a unique garden, with wildlife in mind

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Lister yearns for intelligent conversation with people he actually likes, but with only Rimmer for company, he is forced to take desperate action - sitting the chef's exam. Sci-fi comedy, starring Chris Barrie, Craig Charles and Norman Lovett

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: No Activity
programme.desc: Hendy works with an American detective while Stokes is back at the station reporting on the shooting incident, and struggles to contain his admiration for his new partner. Carol shares reminiscences of her romantic past with April

programme.title: ODI Cricket Highlights
programme.desc: England v New Zealand. Action from the first game in the four-match series, held at Sophia Gardens in Cardiff. This was the first ODI meeting between the two sides since the World Cup final in 2019, when England famously won their first World Cup title in a dramatic Super Over at Lord's

programme.title: Murder Trial: The Disappearance of Renee and Andrew MacRae
programme.desc: The trial of William MacDowell continues and the jury members hear the dramatic testimony of Renee's best friend and confidante, while the senior investigating officer retraces MacDowell's steps on the night in question. There is compelling testimony suggesting MacDowell attempted to create a fake alibi, and a final witness is called as the Crown's case nears conclusion

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his exploration of Scotland's spectacular west coast from the Firth of Clyde to the Outer Hebrides. From the 250-year old 'new town' of Helensburgh on the north bank of the Clyde, Michael takes his favourite West Highland Line across epic landscapes to Garelochhead and Ben Cruachan, and makes his way to Connel Bridge and the waters of Loch Etive

programme.title: Climbing Great Buildings
programme.desc: Jonathan Foyle is aided by Lucy Creamer as he climbs Burghley House in Lincolnshire, which was built to impress Queen Elizabeth I on her many trips around the country. He scales the roof to view a playground of hidden ornate sculpture where royalty and ambassadors were entertained, and deciphers the mysterious symbols that adorn the structure

programme.title: Caligula with Mary Beard
programme.desc: Roman emperor Gaius Julius Caesar Augustus Germanicus - better known as Caligula - was said to have made his horse a consul, proclaimed himself a living God and indulged in scandalous orgies. In this documentary, classical scholar Mary Beard attempts to peel away some of the myths surrounding him, sifting through surviving evidence to paint a portrait of the real Caligula

programme.title: Colosseum
programme.desc: All Roman rulers put great value on spectacles and games, but only one, the son of Marcus Aurelius, steps out of the Imperial Box and onto the sands of the arena. As Emperor Commodus makes enemies amongst the ruling Senate, a deadly game of cat and mouse ensues

programme.title: Colosseum
programme.desc: By the 4th century AD, a divided Roman Empire is rocked by devastating earthquakes, fires, barbarian invasions and deep religious divides. As Rome declines, the Colosseum, which once stood as a proud symbol of the Empire's glory, lies empty. To restore Rome, one man, a devout worshipper of the Rome's old gods, turns to the arena

programme.title: I, Claudius
programme.desc: The Praetorian Guard hold Claudius under protective custody as the Senate debates the return of the Republic. Messalina enjoys the trappings of power and talks her husband into recalling Appius Silanus from Spain so he can marry her mother, and the engineers are ordered to survey Ostia for all weather harbour improvements

programme.title: I, Claudius
programme.desc: As Claudius continues his conquest of Britain, Messalina runs wild with lust. After competing in a tournament of sex, in which she takes on the champion of the Guild of Prostitutes, Sylla, she begins a rebellion of her own. However, her decision to proceed with a divorce and publicly marry new lover Silius leads to disastrous consequences. Derek Jacobi and Sheila White star

programme.title: I, Claudius
programme.desc: As he approaches the end of his years, Claudius is urged to re-marry and decides upon the scheming Agrippinilla as his new spouse - despite knowing she will try to make her son Nero the emperor. Derek Jacobi stars

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his exploration of Scotland's spectacular west coast from the Firth of Clyde to the Outer Hebrides. From the 250-year old 'new town' of Helensburgh on the north bank of the Clyde, Michael takes his favourite West Highland Line across epic landscapes to Garelochhead and Ben Cruachan, and makes his way to Connel Bridge and the waters of Loch Etive

programme.title: Caligula with Mary Beard
programme.desc: Roman emperor Gaius Julius Caesar Augustus Germanicus - better known as Caligula - was said to have made his horse a consul, proclaimed himself a living God and indulged in scandalous orgies. In this documentary, classical scholar Mary Beard attempts to peel away some of the myths surrounding him, sifting through surviving evidence to paint a portrait of the real Caligula

programme.title: The Riviera: A History in Pictures
programme.desc: Part one of two. Actor Richard E Grant follows in the footsteps of artists who lived and painted on France's Cote d'Azur, renowned for its sunny climate. The first edition focuses on the relationship between modern art and the location's development as an international tourist haven. Cezanne, Monet and Renoir were captivated by the light and colour of the landscape in the 19th century and their resultant work advertised the region's beauty. Meanwhile, the area's vivid hues inspired Henri Matisse to adopt a new palette that set modern art on the route to abstraction

programme.title: Mozart's Great Mass at the Proms
programme.desc: John Butt conducts Baroque ensemble the Dunedin Consort in Mozart's Great Mass in C minor, recorded at the BBC Proms on Sunday August 6. They are joined on stage by an all-star roster of vocal soloists - Nardus Williams, Lucy Crowe, Jess Dandy, Benjamin Hulett and Robert Davies - for this much-loved work, which takes up the entire second half of the concert. for the first half, the ensemble performs a series of shorter pieces by JS Bach and CPE Bach, two men who inspired Mozart in the creation of his mighty Mass. Presented by Katie Derham, with guest Anna Lapwood

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: John Peel and Janice Long introduce performances by Bucks Fizz, Spandau Ballet, Sister Sledge, Level 42, Alphaville and Stevie Wonder

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Peter Powell presents an edition from September 7, 1978, featuring performances by the Jam, Leo Sayer, Boney M, the Motors, Dee D Jackson, Sylvester, Manhattan Transfer, Hi-Tension, Hylda Baker and Arthur Mullard, and the Commodores. Plus, dance sequences by Legs & Co

programme.title: Adele at the BBC
programme.desc: In a one-off special, the singer-songwriter is joined by her band to perform classic tracks, as well as songs from her new album 25. In between numbers, Adele talks to Graham Norton about her career and life and she also gets up close and personal with some of her biggest fans. The show includes the first TV performance of Skyfall since the 85th Academy Awards in February 2013, where Adele won the Oscar for Best Original Song for the theme tune to the 23rd James Bond film

programme.title: Radio 2 Live
programme.desc: Michael and his big band perform classic standards and Buble originals in a 2020 performance at the BBC Radio Theatre, including All of Me, Georgia, All I Do, Home, Haven't Met You Yet and Crazy Love

programme.title: BBC Four Sessions
programme.desc: Concert by Irish singer-songwriter Damien Rice, performing tracks from his 2003 album O, which garnered rave reviews in the UK and helped him win the prestigious Shortlist Music Prize in America

programme.title: Duffy: BBC Sessions
programme.desc: Performance by the Welsh singer-songwriter, featuring tracks from her best-selling 2008 debut album Rockferry, including Mercy, Rockferry and Warwick Avenue, backed by a five-piece band and a string section. Originally broadcast in 2008

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his exploration of Scotland's spectacular west coast from the Firth of Clyde to the Outer Hebrides. From the 250-year old 'new town' of Helensburgh on the north bank of the Clyde, Michael takes his favourite West Highland Line across epic landscapes to Garelochhead and Ben Cruachan, and makes his way to Connel Bridge and the waters of Loch Etive

programme.title: Caligula with Mary Beard
programme.desc: Roman emperor Gaius Julius Caesar Augustus Germanicus - better known as Caligula - was said to have made his horse a consul, proclaimed himself a living God and indulged in scandalous orgies. In this documentary, classical scholar Mary Beard attempts to peel away some of the myths surrounding him, sifting through surviving evidence to paint a portrait of the real Caligula

programme.title: The Riviera: A History in Pictures
programme.desc: Part one of two. Actor Richard E Grant follows in the footsteps of artists who lived and painted on France's Cote d'Azur, renowned for its sunny climate. The first edition focuses on the relationship between modern art and the location's development as an international tourist haven. Cezanne, Monet and Renoir were captivated by the light and colour of the landscape in the 19th century and their resultant work advertised the region's beauty. Meanwhile, the area's vivid hues inspired Henri Matisse to adopt a new palette that set modern art on the route to abstraction

programme.title: Mozart's Great Mass at the Proms
programme.desc: John Butt conducts Baroque ensemble the Dunedin Consort in Mozart's Great Mass in C minor, recorded at the BBC Proms on Sunday August 6. They are joined on stage by an all-star roster of vocal soloists - Nardus Williams, Lucy Crowe, Jess Dandy, Benjamin Hulett and Robert Davies - for this much-loved work, which takes up the entire second half of the concert. for the first half, the ensemble performs a series of shorter pieces by JS Bach and CPE Bach, two men who inspired Mozart in the creation of his mighty Mass. Presented by Katie Derham, with guest Anna Lapwood

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: John Peel and Janice Long introduce performances by Bucks Fizz, Spandau Ballet, Sister Sledge, Level 42, Alphaville and Stevie Wonder

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Peter Powell presents an edition from September 7, 1978, featuring performances by the Jam, Leo Sayer, Boney M, the Motors, Dee D Jackson, Sylvester, Manhattan Transfer, Hi-Tension, Hylda Baker and Arthur Mullard, and the Commodores. Plus, dance sequences by Legs & Co

programme.title: Adele at the BBC
programme.desc: In a one-off special, the singer-songwriter is joined by her band to perform classic tracks, as well as songs from her new album 25. In between numbers, Adele talks to Graham Norton about her career and life and she also gets up close and personal with some of her biggest fans. The show includes the first TV performance of Skyfall since the 85th Academy Awards in February 2013, where Adele won the Oscar for Best Original Song for the theme tune to the 23rd James Bond film

programme.title: Radio 2 Live
programme.desc: Michael and his big band perform classic standards and Buble originals in a 2020 performance at the BBC Radio Theatre, including All of Me, Georgia, All I Do, Home, Haven't Met You Yet and Crazy Love

programme.title: BBC Four Sessions
programme.desc: Concert by Irish singer-songwriter Damien Rice, performing tracks from his 2003 album O, which garnered rave reviews in the UK and helped him win the prestigious Shortlist Music Prize in America

programme.title: Duffy: BBC Sessions
programme.desc: Performance by the Welsh singer-songwriter, featuring tracks from her best-selling 2008 debut album Rockferry, including Mercy, Rockferry and Warwick Avenue, backed by a five-piece band and a string section. Originally broadcast in 2008

programme.desc: The hairy hero worries about showing people his favourite conch shell when everyone else has unicorn-themed items for their show and tell presentations

Plus, we find out why earthworms are so important to the planet by being amazing soil engineers.

programme.title: Maddie, the Plants and You
programme.desc: Join Maddie to discover the plants that we use in our everyday lives and how we can help to look after them and our planet. We use plants like bamboo to build with, we make clothes from plants, and we even turn plants into useful materials like rubber for making wellington boots. And wood we use for musical instruments! Along the way, we discover how latex comes from inside a rubber tree, and Maddie goes high into the rainforest canopy to show us how tall a bamboo plant grows. She also makes a bowl from a banana leaf.

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: Delivery Duckling arrives and tells Love Monster he has been chosen to be sipping host at a special Hot Chocolate Day ceremony. She then cycles off before telling him what a sipping host does. Love Monster goes to Elder Panda to ask his advice, and he tells him there are many ways to serve hot chocolate - each person needs to find their own unique way. Elder Panda adds honey and banana from his garden to his. Love Monster starts the ceremony by adding his signature marshmallows, but then Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny announces she puts marshmallows in hers too. Love Monster thinks he needs to use something more unusual, so he adds pickles, but this doesn't go down well - in fact, it tastes horrible! It turns out the reason why he was chosen was so that he could make hot chocolate the way he always makes it. He does, and everyone loves it.

Meanwhile, Ayo is missing the weather she can experience back on Earth, so she and Sam recreate different weather conditions using items around the lab

programme.desc: The squirrels want to play outside on a very windy day, and Duggee suggests they all go fly his kite

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.desc: Peter learns not to judge a book by its cover when he takes an elderly tortoise for a quiet walk in the woods. Animated tale inspired by Beatrix Potter

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: The team discovers a strange rock that is home to a new species of worm

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey's having fun copying everything Dad says and does

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea takes over the Tato Tower HQ and uses Carrot's new security system to keep Supertato out

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: Lars and Kyan swim through the shallows of Crystal River in Florida. Kyan tests his new swimming fin, while Lars watches a manatee and her baby cruise by. Xuli is water-skiing further downstream in the open waters of Crystal Bay, while Foz and Ubercorn watch on from Jet Pad. Grandmaster Glitch is taking the tourist family on a mermaid spotting tour of Crystal River aboard his Grimmer-boat. As Glitch heads off in search of real mermaids, he accidentally startles the mother manatee. Ubercorn realises the manatee will be in danger from the speeding boats and from the cold deep water. The Go Jetters need to mount a manatee rescue quickly. While Xuli attempts to stop the speedboats, Foz launches the Vroomster. The baby manatee has become attached to Kyan, so Lars suggests he remains with her, while Lars and Foz go to save the mother. Kyan is not happy at having to play baby-sitter.

programme.title: GiggleQuiz
programme.desc: Professor Muddles's new invention, the Quiz Fit, causes chaos for Keith as he tries to exercise and quiz at the same time. Meanwhile, Nana catches cabbages in her Panto Showdown

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: Waffle is staying at Angela's kennels while the Brooklyn-Bells are on holiday.

programme.title: Sarah & Duck
programme.desc: Rainbow gets to experience the night for the first time

programme.title: JoJo & Gran Gran
programme.desc: JoJo has a sleepover at Gran Gran's, but bedtime comes while it's still light outside.

programme.title: Moon and Me
programme.desc: Everybody is very surprised to discover the Roundabout has been left in the sitting room

programme.title: Clangers
programme.desc: Mother's garden gets very hot and her flowers start wilting, and when Major's auto-waterer fails to work Tiny comes up with an idea for watering the garden using a marble chute toy

programme.title: In the Night Garden
programme.desc: The Wottingers visit the Pontipines, but they keep missing each other. Narrated by Derek Jacobi

programme.desc: Laura Haddock reads a tale about Class One's favourite friend, the Everywhere Bear

programme.desc: Tee is having a tired day, so Mo challenges him to lots of races, allowing him to win every time. Tee loves beating Mo, but soon discovers that winning isnt everything.

programme.title: Justin's House

programme.title: Bing

programme.title: Yakka Dee!
programme.desc: Dee encourages a friend to say chicken, and we go on a whirlwind word adventure! We see lots of chickens a brown chicken, a white chicken, a clucking chicken and some friendly chickens. Dee meets a funky chicken, a hatching chicken and a cock-a-doodle-do-ing chicken! The journey is repeated with some special surprises along the way, and everyone has a boogie when Dees friend finally succeeds in saying todays word!

programme.title: Messy Goes to OKIDO
programme.desc: Messy and friends enter a race in Okido and the various vehicles speed off! But who has the power to win the mystery prize?

programme.title: Colourblocks
programme.desc: Brown takes the Colourblocks exploring in the forest. Learn different ways to mix brown with the Colourblocks.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The Twirlywoos discover what happens when a toy train enters a tunnel, and they have some trouble with disappearing tea

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies find different uses for their favourite things and a child in Tummy Tales makes a seaside picture out of lots of things from a make-and-do box. In Teletubbyland a large tube appears. The Teletubbies use it as a telescope and as a loud speaker

programme.title: The Baby Club
programme.desc: Babies and their grown-ups play with lots of hats and enjoy songs and story time together.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Harvest time arrives, and Duggee's garden is over-flowing with newly ripened crops, but there are so many it will take him forever to pick them all

programme.title: Roots and Fruits
programme.desc: Live from the Roots and Fruits theatre, its the Peas performing their hap-pea double act and showing that, although they look alike, they definitely dont think alike.

programme.title: Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Minty tries to fly and is mistaken for a baby Bokchoydactyl

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey struggles to train her new pet Shaun, an unruly and troublesome emu.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea wears a giant power suit

programme.title: Let's Go for a Walk
programme.desc: Ranger Hamza and the Ramblers walk to the beach to play a game with their ball. On the way, they find some mountains and meet a dragon, spot treasure at the antiques shop, make sounds like the tide bell, and even discover a giant egg!

programme.title: School of Roars
programme.desc: Wufflebump is determined to put on the best puppet show ever, and he wants everything to be perfect.

programme.title: Teeny Tiny Creatures
programme.desc: Xiangfeng wants to know all about amazing ants! Ferne visits a leaf cutter ant colony at the zoo, while Rory and his son Sandy head into the forest, looking for wood ants. Plus, we find out how ants play an important role in the growing of plants and crops. They are amazing soil engineers!

programme.title: Our Family
programme.desc: Amanpreet challenges her sister Amrit to a biking competition to see who can cycle around the bike track the fastest. But who will win? The bikes get really muddy, so Amanpreet takes charge of giving them a good clean and has some splashy fun with the hosepipe too. Later, she makes delicious shortbread for the whole family, including a special biscuit for little brother Arjun.

programme.title: My World Kitchen
programme.desc: Feijoada is a Brazilian stew containing black beans and many other delicious ingredients

programme.title: Maddie, the Plants and You
programme.desc: Join Maddie on an adventure around the world of trees to see how we can help look after them and our planet. Discover how trees grow, how we can tell the age of trees and how the roots, leaves and bark work. Maddie shows how trees are home to lots of other plants, animals, birds and insects who live on and amongst them and have an important role in our ecosystem. Well discover a trees leaves make energy using sunlight, so they can keep growing. We learn that a tree is alive, it drinks and breathes and grows just like we do! And well find out about deciduous trees that lose their leaves in winter and evergreens that keep their leaves all year round.

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: It's the hottest day of the year and Waffle is eating ice cream to cool down. Outside in the sweltering heat, Simon turns on the sprinkler to help everyone cool down, but poor Waffle doesn't like the sprinkler and darts through the hole in the fence to Mrs Hobbs's garden, looking for shade. The Brooklyn-Bells try to coax him back, but he refuses to return. Doug decides to make a mini swimming pool by filling the ball pit with cool water. Waffle loves swimming pools. Maybe that will encourage him back?

programme.title: Andy's Dinosaur Adventures
programme.desc: A journey back 65 million years to the time of the Tyrannosaurus Rex and its existence in North America

programme.title: Yakka Dee!
programme.desc: Dee encourages a friend to say moon' and we go on a whirlwind word adventure

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.desc: Learn all about the number 3 with Numberblock Three, who arrives with a bang - and a song-and-dance about her favourite number

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: I and N join together to make 'in', and find themselves trapped inside something big and red

programme.title: Dog Loves Books
programme.desc: Pug wants to break a world record. Dog suggests they go to the North Pole so that Pug can be the first pug to reach the Pole. They have some help from a Walrus, but when they arrive they see Granny Pug has got there first. Pug breaks another world record.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee is painting in his favourite colouring book. The Squirrels want to have a go too - Betty wants to paint a bee that's yellow, while Tag paints a fire truck that's red, while Happy paints some water blue. However, when it's Norrie's turn she cannot find the paint colour she wants

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: Love Monster has been chosen as the prize-picker at the Harvest Day contest, but when he gets there it turns out there is only one prize and three teams. This means he has to choose a winner between his friends - Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny, Bad Idea Puppy and the In-Chicks. Round one is fancy fashion foodies, and everyone loves Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny, so Love Monster thinks he can just pick her. Then it is round two - the veggie variety show. Everyone loves the In-Chicks, so Love Monster now has to choose between them and Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny. Then it is the final round, which is the tantalizing taste test of home grown goodies, and this time everyone loves Bad Idea Puppy. Love Monster has no idea how he can pick a winner and runs off and hides, but then he realises Bad Idea Puppy always makes him laugh, so he declares him the winner.

programme.title: Colourblocks
programme.desc: Green arrives, bringing her natural colour to Colourland. Learn about the colour green.

programme.title: Something Special
programme.desc: Justin and his friends visit a fairy forest

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies feel tired after doing lots of keep fit exercises, but are ready for action again after eating lots of Tubby Custard

programme.title: Dipdap
programme.desc: The Line draws a radio for Dip Dap, but a noisy seal prevents him enjoying the music

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: The Grape Kids learn how to camp Supertato-style, but Evil Pea arrives and wows them with her ice camping

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: Glitch's trip to a funky floating farm becomes a rescue mission on a fast-flowing river.

programme.title: Time for School
programme.desc: Nutsy the toy squirrel comes to school!

programme.title: Small Potatoes
programme.desc: The gang celebrates the four seasons, and sing a folksy song about all the exciting things each new time of the year brings

programme.title: Andy's Aquatic Adventures
programme.desc: After a tropical rain during the night at Safari World, Andy has been making sure all the animals are safe. Apart from being a little damp, thankfully they're all okay

programme.title: Get Set Galactic
programme.desc: Two teams touch down at the STARS space station to take on three scientific challenges to win out-of-this world prizes. First, they must work out if an object is heavier or lighter than another before placing it on a giant set of scales. Then, theres a healthy eating quiz based on the food groups that make up a balanced diet. Finally, the teams must take items from a giant conveyer belt and sort them so they can be reused and recycled. To make it even trickier, the players are attached to bungee cords! Meanwhile, Sam and Ayo have installed an update on the supercomputer but now it wont do what its supposed to do. They must fix the computer by giving it a list of coded instructions

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The Squirrels spot strange dots with tails wriggling around in Duggie's new rock pool, and are confused to learn they are baby frogs

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.desc: Peter promises to find the mice a new home, but locating a suitable place proves to be an adventure in itself

programme.title: Grace's Amazing Machines
programme.desc: Motorbike rider Grace shows off three machines that all move because of propellers. She flies a seaplane, shows off unusual hydrocopter and goes for a fast ride in a raceboat

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: The underwater explorers encounter a snapping shrimp, a small creature that uses its claws to make a loud noise

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey and Bingos plans to stay up late are derailed when Muffin misses her nap.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bingo makes everything heavy with a swish of her wand

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea freezes the Veggies so she can take over the whole supermarket

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: While Xuli and Kyan brush up on their Vroomster skills, Tala, Lars and Foz help the Academys banana crop by removing some vines that were constricting the trees. Nearby, Glitch prepares a picnic for Ubercorn. Tala drops by to deliver some fresh bananas for the picnic and Foz spots a tiny ant on the fruit. Tala asks her Uncle to shrink her, Foz and Lars with his size-ray. The tiny Go Jetters discover the ants will accept them as one of their own if they rub the insects smell on them. Now they are no longer a threat, the team follows the ants into their tree. Ubercorn and Glitch tuck into their picnic, but an ant steals the cherry from Glitchs cake and takes it inside the tree. Unable fit inside, Glitch uses his size-ray to shrink himself and zooms after the ant. Inside the tree, the ants see Glitch as a threat and start to surround him. He makes a run for it, but they pursue him down the trunk. Glitch demands the Grimbots make him bigger again, but they miss and accidentally blast an

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee's makes some delicious pancakes, but the clubhouse is out of honey. Energetic animation for children aged two to five, following Duggee the dog and his Squirrel Club

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee is having a lovely cup of tea in his favourite cup when Roly surprises him with a very loud 'Peek-a-Boo', which is so loud that Duggee jumps and drops his cup which shatters into pieces

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: Waffle tries to be a purr-fect house guest for Mrs Hobbs but he misses the Brooklyn-Bells

programme.title: Sarah & Duck
programme.desc: Scarf Lady's poetry records inspire a snowy train ride to the mountains

programme.title: JoJo & Gran Gran
programme.desc: JoJo and Gran Gran play holidays' in the park and have a stay-at-home adventure.

programme.title: Moon and Me
programme.desc: Mr Onion discovers a picnic basket in the curiosity box

programme.title: Clangers
programme.desc: A special star passes over the planet that is meant to make the star roses bloom, but the flowers fail to appear

programme.title: In the Night Garden
programme.desc: Upsy Daisy dances in the garden with the Haahoos and the daisies

programme.title: CBeebies Bedtime Stories
programme.desc: Stories for bedtime.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: A fire crew in Burnley come under attack on their busiest night of the year and in Swindon, two paramedics are violently assaulted by a patient. Derbyshire police tackle the drug gangs crossing their county lines

programme.title: Expert Witness
programme.desc: A British facial reconstruction expert helps uncover the identity of a body washed up on a Dutch beach and a forensic linguistic specialist leads the hunt for evidence against an Edinburgh bomber

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin is delighted with the quirky original features he finds in a house in Staffordshire, and Tommy Walsh meets a sports insurer who is keen to try out his DIY skills on an end-of-terrace in Suffolk. Martin Roberts, meanwhile, is surprised by the extra benefits that come with a pair of old garages in south London

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion presents as two teams search for antiques in Leominster, Herefordshire, led by experts Kate Bliss and Tim Weeks. Christina learns about 'The Leominster Chelsea Bun', which travelled to the battlefields of the First World War and back

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Rosie has a surprising request for Barry and the Mill staff deal with the events of the previous night. Suni meets a young man who is trying to cope with the ghosts of his past

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: At Wallyford recycling centre, JJ Chalmers finds a glass fronted cabinet for Joel Poole to fix-up, an old wicker trunk for Sarah Peterson to makeover and a pair of wooden doors that he plans on upcycling himself

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton is on a property-searching mission in the Devon countryside, helping a mother and daughter duo with 750,000 find a home for three generations of their family and an eco-camping business. The presenter also visits Chagford Community Farm, one of the UK's first community-supported micro-dairies and sees how residents are readily signing up to buying its local produce

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Chris Hull visit Doris and Petra in Stoke on Trent who want to turn their higledy-piggledy garden full of trip hazards, into a safe space inspired by the German meadows that surrounded Doris's childhood home with a budget of 4,000

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host this quiz contest, in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win 5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which five pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Konnie Huq

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present the magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Ian's business lunch with Suki and Nish doesn't go to plan and Peter tries to make amends with Gina and Anna. Sonia and Reiss head to their first fertility appointment and Freddie is consumed by guilt

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Steve Fletcher works on a mantle clock in the shape of a ship, a treasured gift from the owner's late grandfather. Kirsten Ramsay is called upon to painstakingly piece together a vintage ceramic night light, fractured into dozens of fragments, and skateboard enthusiast Mike is hoping Will Kirk and Dominic Chinea can restore his wooden board, which transports him back to his youth in 1960s Liverpool. Finally, toy restorers Julie and Amanda undertake the repair of a treasured teddy bear that has been by the side of a young man as he's undergone life-changing surgery

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The four remaining chefs must create a theatrical showstopping dish which will decide who makes it to the next challenge. The final three then face the Chef's Table hosted by Robin Gill. The finalists must deliver exceptional food to a table of professional restaurateurs including Raymond Blanc, Daniel Clifford, Anna Haugh, Nieves Barragan Mohacho and Matt Gillan

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Being Louis Rees-Zammit
programme.desc: Unfiltered access to rugby's new superstar. From the intense training off the field to the post-match debriefs with his family at home, this is what it is like to be Louis Rees-Zammit. Includes contributions from team-mate Dan Biggar and World Cup Winner and top try scorer, Bryan Habana

programme.title: If Beale Street Could Talk (2018)
programme.desc: In early 1970s Harlem, 19-year old Tish Rivers recalls the longtime relationship between her and fianc Alonzo 'Fonny' Hunt. With a child on the way, their plans of starting a family and embracing the future are derailed when Fonny is arrested for a crime he did not commit. Director Barry Jenkins' Oscar-winning drama, starring KiKi Layne and Stephan James

programme.desc: Xiangfeng wants to know all about amazing ants! Ferne visits a leaf cutter ant colony at the zoo, while Rory and his son Sandy head into the forest, looking for wood ants. Plus, we find out how ants play an important role in the growing of plants and crops. They are amazing soil engineers!

programme.title: Our Family
programme.desc: Amanpreet challenges her sister Amrit to a biking competition to see who can cycle around the bike track the fastest. But who will win? The bikes get really muddy, so Amanpreet takes charge of giving them a good clean and has some splashy fun with the hosepipe too. Later, she makes delicious shortbread for the whole family, including a special biscuit for little brother Arjun.

programme.title: My World Kitchen
programme.desc: Feijoada is a Brazilian stew containing black beans and many other delicious ingredients

programme.title: Maddie, the Plants and You
programme.desc: Join Maddie on an adventure around the world of trees to see how we can help look after them and our planet. Discover how trees grow, how we can tell the age of trees and how the roots, leaves and bark work. Maddie shows how trees are home to lots of other plants, animals, birds and insects who live on and amongst them and have an important role in our ecosystem. Well discover a trees leaves make energy using sunlight, so they can keep growing. We learn that a tree is alive, it drinks and breathes and grows just like we do! And well find out about deciduous trees that lose their leaves in winter and evergreens that keep their leaves all year round.

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: It's the hottest day of the year and Waffle is eating ice cream to cool down. Outside in the sweltering heat, Simon turns on the sprinkler to help everyone cool down, but poor Waffle doesn't like the sprinkler and darts through the hole in the fence to Mrs Hobbs's garden, looking for shade. The Brooklyn-Bells try to coax him back, but he refuses to return. Doug decides to make a mini swimming pool by filling the ball pit with cool water. Waffle loves swimming pools. Maybe that will encourage him back?

programme.title: Andy's Dinosaur Adventures

programme.title: Hey Duggee

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: Love Monster has been chosen as the prize-picker at the Harvest Day contest, but when he gets there it turns out there is only one prize and three teams. This means he has to choose a winner between his friends - Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny, Bad Idea Puppy and the In-Chicks. Round one is fancy fashion foodies, and everyone loves Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny, so Love Monster thinks he can just pick her. Then it is round two - the veggie variety show. Everyone loves the In-Chicks, so Love Monster now has to choose between them and Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny. Then it is the final round, which is the tantalizing taste test of home grown goodies, and this time everyone loves Bad Idea Puppy. Love Monster has no idea how he can pick a winner and runs off and hides, but then he realises Bad Idea Puppy always makes him laugh, so he declares him the winner.

Finally, the teams must take items from a giant conveyer belt and sort them so they can be reused and recycled. To make it even trickier, the players are attached to bungee cords! Nearby, Glitch prepares a picnic for Ubercorn. Tala drops by to deliver some fresh bananas for the picnic and Foz spots a tiny ant on the fruit. Tala asks her Uncle to shrink her, Foz and Lars with his size-ray. The tiny Go Jetters discover the ants will accept them as one of their own if they rub the insects smell on them. Now they are no longer a threat, the team follows the ants into their tree. Ubercorn and Glitch tuck into their picnic, but an ant steals the cherry from Glitchs cake and takes it inside the tree. Unable fit inside, Glitch uses his size-ray to shrink himself and zooms after the ant. Inside the tree, the ants see Glitch as a threat and start to surround him. programme.desc: Stacey and her team of exerts help more families declutter their homes, beginning with Tom and Chloe Watling and their two daughters. All their possessions are packed up and laid out in a giant warehouse, including 459 books and magazines, 326 pieces of baking equipment, 39 unopened travel-sized jars of jam and 1,672 toys. programme.desc: At the start of a busy 12-hour night shift for the North West Ambulance Service, a call is received for a 43-year-old male patient unable to speak. While a high proportion of the calls being received are drug or alcohol-related, advanced paramedic Shaun finds himself dispatched to a baby born in the passenger seat of a car. programme.title: 9/11: Inside the President's War Room
programme.desc: Almost 20 years since September 11, this feature-length documentary follows President George W Bush and his staff as they dealt with the large-scale terrorist attack, in which four commercial aircraft were used as missiles on the World Trade Centre and the Pentagon. The events of that day led to two decades of conflict in Afghanistan and Iraq. As America and its allies now withdraw from Afghanistan and the Taliban resume control, this is the story of how it all began. The film features testimony from George W Bush himself, as well as staff members Dick Cheney, Condoleezza Rice and Colin Powell

programme.title: Rugby World Cup 2023 Live
programme.desc: France v New Zealand (Kick-off 8.15pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the opening match of the tournament, as the Pool A rivals meet at Stade de France in Paris. The hosts reached the quarter-finals four years ago in Japan and will be expecting a strong showing this time around in front of their own fans. However, they begin their tournament with arguably the toughest possible fixture, as the All Blacks go into the tournament as favourites to lift the trophy despite losing out to England in the semi-finals in 2019. With analysis from Jonny Wilkinson, Brian O'Driscoll and Maggie Alphonsi, reports by Jill Douglas, Bryan Habana, Sean Fitzpatrick and Benjamin Kayser, and commentary by Miles Harrison, Ben Kay and Jamie Roberts

programme.title: James Martin's Spanish Adventure
programme.desc: The chef visits Santiago De Compostela, meets pilgrims, and explores the local market. James later tries lampreys, visits a bakery to try Tarta de Santiago, and takes a mussel boat tour. He also cooks a seafood stew, T-bone steak, empanadas and rice with mussels

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Taking part are couple Kate and Stu from Worcestershire, plus two teams from Wiltshire - couple Robbie and Aimee - and Debs and her son Ben. They use their skills to find words from the fewest letters possible. Adil Ray hosts

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: All that stands between Miranda from Llanybydder, Andre from Cambridge, Beverley from Rutland and David from Twickenham and thousands of pounds is the not-so-small matter of one of the Chasers. Bradley Walsh asks the questions, but do they have the answers?

programme.title: ITV News London

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Rugby World Cup 2023 Live
programme.desc: France v New Zealand (Kick-off 8.15pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the opening match of the tournament, as the Pool A rivals meet at Stade de France in Paris. The hosts reached the quarter-finals four years ago in Japan and will be expecting a strong showing this time around in front of their own fans. However, they begin their tournament with arguably the toughest possible fixture, as the All Blacks go into the tournament as favourites to lift the trophy despite losing out to England in the semi-finals in 2019. With analysis from Jonny Wilkinson, Brian O'Driscoll and Maggie Alphonsi, reports by Jill Douglas, Bryan Habana, Sean Fitzpatrick and Benjamin Kayser, and commentary by Miles Harrison, Ben Kay and Jamie Roberts

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: The Queen (2006)
programme.desc: Oscar-winning fact-based drama, examining the events surrounding the death of Princess Diana. The relationship between the monarch and Prime Minister Tony Blair is revealed as they struggle to reach a compromise in dealing with the situation. Starring Helen Mirren in an Oscar-winning role, alongside Michael Sheen, James Cromwell, Helen McCrory and Sylvia Syms

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Bob calls in sick, leaving the Woolpack short-staffed and presenting Chastity with a golden opportunity to ask for her job back. Meanwhile, Charity has yet another argument with Cain and walks out, prompting a concerned Tom King to offer her the spare room at Holdgate Farm

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Charity discovers Jimmy King disapproves of her presence at Holdgate Farm and begins making alternative arrangements, while Scott comforts a distraught Zoe, who confesses she couldn't manage without him

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Bev gets the bit between her teeth, determined to prove Peter has another woman, and Martin struggles to handle the guilt over his secret relationship with Katy - especially when it causes him to neglect David

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: As everyone prepares for the wedding of the year, Bev is still convinced Peter is going to break her daughter's heart and urges Shelley to confront him before she makes the biggest mistake of her life

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Stan and Jack decide to get fit, disturbed to learn that bus crews have a short life expectancy. Comedy, with Reg Varney

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Jack and Stan volunteer Olive as supervisor for the depot nursery. However, when she breaks her glasses and has to go home for a spare pair the clueless duo are left holding the fort. Comedy, starring Reg Varney, Bob Grant and Anna Karen

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Ruth considers starting a new life in Australia and Simon realises the new shareholder at the paper factory is conspiring against him. Stephen makes careful plans to get pregnant Jacqui to the hospital _ which are wrecked when she goes into labour just as Skelthwaite is hit by a power cut. Rural drama, starring Sarah Lancashire, Pam Ferris, Marsha Thomason, Jason Done and Thomas Craig

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Anna Kirkwall starts late on the first day of her new job at Skelthwaite Health Centre. Meanwhile, preparations for Jake's christening are under way, and Simon is in Australia trying to persuade Ruth to come home with their son Alfie

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Miller's old Army captain shows up to make him a business proposition, which he turns down without regret. However, when Walker and Belay are called to investigate a vehicle theft, it becomes clear the sergeant's old friend has other matters to take care of in Aidensfield. Meanwhile, Gina is reluctant to let Jack paint her in the nude. Rural Sixties drama, with John Duttine and Jonathan Kerrigan

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Despite Rob's efforts to keep his wedding secret, his sisters enlist the help of the community to organise a surprise reception as the policeman prepares to marry Helen. A man's complaint about noisy neighbours turns sour when his mentally ill wife takes matters into her own hands, and Gina learns Jack's nude painting of her is to go on public display. Drama, with Jonathan Kerrigan and Sophie Ward

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Zoe hosts a dinner party at Home Farm and makes a pass at a guest - but finds her overtures rejected and seeks solace in the arms of Scott. Meanwhile, the Kings continue to plan the shindig of the year, hoping it will win over the locals

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Scott declares his feelings for Zoe but receives a humiliating rebuff and ends up spending the night with Chloe. Jack turns down the offer of a holiday with Diane, while Katie decides to go and stay with her mum

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: On what should be the happiest day of her life, Shelley is wondering whether to go through with the wedding in light of Peter's bombshell. Mum Bev is adamant she shouldn't, but Peter is a very persuasive man - will he win his bride-to-be round?

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: A royal visit to a family owned munitions factory puts a spring in the step of Chief Superintendent Bright, but Morse is still stuck on general duties and excluded from the event. However, when an unpopular worker is found murdered in a secluded area of the shop floor, the detective finds himself drawn into the affairs of the company and its dysfunctional owners. The prime suspect is a colleague who had fallen out with the victim over an industrial accident, and Bright is eager for the investigation to be carried out as quickly and quietly as possible, but Endeavour is not convinced the case can be solved so easily. Shaun Evans stars, with Martin Jarvis, Jenny Seagrove and Craig Parkinson

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Aidensfield's policemen struggle to deduce who could be behind a spate of sheep rustling, while Peggy is intrigued by an eco-warrior couple's slurry-fuelled generator. Helen is called in after the body of an elderly woman is found in the river, while the dead woman's son finds it difficult to deal with the consequences of his mother's demise. Drama, starring Jonathan Kerrigan and Sophie Ward

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: When a woman is involved in a hit-and-run following a local dance, Miller finds himself racing to discover the identity of the culprit. Meanwhile, David decides he has had enough of Peggy's miserly ways and walks out on the taxi service

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: When a housewife is found hanged in her home, the police initially mark it down as suicide. However, a meeting with an Oxford law professor prompts a sceptical Lewis and Hathaway to believe something more sinister is afoot - a suspicion confirmed by the death of another woman. Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox star

programme.title: Manhunt
programme.desc: With absolutely no guarantee it will work, the Force Tasking Group have to come to a decision about funding Colin's high stakes gamble. Meanwhile, the news of a new and very vicious attack on an elderly lady makes the team all the more determined to catch their prey. Fact-based crime drama about the police investigation to bring serial killer Levi Bellfield to justice. Starring Martin Clunes, Sule Rimi and Steve Nicolson

programme.desc: The rift between Joe and his wife Julianne sees him at his lowest ebb, but he is still determined to untangle the web he is caught up in. He believes that there's a pattern to be found amongst all the coincidences and a breakthrough sets him on a new path of investigation. Meanwhile, DI Ruiz and DS Devi are newly determined to get justice for Catherine, but their own enquiries have hit a roadblock

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: As the sleuth studies for his forthcoming sergeant's exam, he investigates a hit-and-run that claimed the life of an eminent Oxford professor. The victim had been at odds with his peers over the fate of a potentially lucrative parcel of college-owned land, and the case is complicated by the appearance of DI Thursday's old gangland enemy - whom he must face alone while Endeavour makes a trip back to Lincolnshire to visit his ailing father

programme.desc: A prisoner is broken out of Ashfordly prison to pilot a helicopter on a secret mission, and Debbie begins acting strangely when a familiar face returns to the village. Meanwhile, Rob is left distraught when a boy takes revenge for the death of his dog

programme.desc: A Frenchwoman arrives to help with preparations for Aidensfield's twinning with her home town, but things go wrong when she is left to the tender mercies of Peggy. programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The unorthodox but brilliant North East detective investigates when charred human remains are found in an abattoir furnace, and attempts to deduce how and why they got there in the first place. The bones are identified as belonging to a fellow cop, leading Vera to uncover a web of dark secrets as she looks into her dead colleague's fraud squad. Brenda Blethyn dons her familiar hat and mac to play Vera in this mystery, based on the characters created by Ann Cleeves

programme.title: Manhunt
programme.desc: As the search for the rapist continues, the team are losing morale. It seems unlikely Minstead Man will appear again after such a close call. Conclusion of the fact-based drama, starring Martin Clunes
