programme.desc: Jack hears Andy's distraught message on his answering machine and rushes to the farm, where he is greeted by the sound of gunfire, while Ethan is bemused to find a bleary-looking Shadrach sleeping off his latest bender in a newly dug grave

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Robert and Katie check into the bed and breakfast, where Alan Turner makes clear his disapproval by insisting they sleep in separate rooms. Andy announces to a crowded Woolpack that his wife and brother have been sleeping together for months

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Archie gives Audrey the surprise of her life on her birthday. Roy is so ashamed of himself he can't bear to face anyone. Martin and Katy are thrown together once again thanks to Sarah

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Following his shock proposal, Archie wakes up confident that Audrey will accept - but struggles to hide his devastation when she attempts to let him down gently, leading him to consider leaving Weatherfield.

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: Shaun Evans returns as the young Inspector Morse in the first of four feature-length episodes. A baffling suicide, an anguished father searching for his missing daughter and the smash-and-grab robbery of medieval artefacts throw the detective in at the deep end as he resumes his role with Oxford City Police following a four-month absence from duty. As the locals go to the polls in a closely fought by-election and a beauty contest builds to its conclusion, Endeavour must navigate the choppy waters of both worlds as his investigation shakes the highest pillars of Oxford society. Co-starring Roger Allam, Anton Lesser, James Bradshaw, Jack Laskey and Sean Rigby

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A recently released ex-convict who served time for the rape of a local girl becomes the target of a hate campaign - prompting Rob to point the finger of suspicion at the victim's family. The bobby is shocked when old acquaintance DS Rachel Dawson arrives in Aidensfield on the trail of an escaped prisoner, while Peggy accidentally knocks down an old friend with her car. Jonathan Kerrigan stars

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A Russian trawlerman found hiding in a local woman's shed is accused of being a spy by a Home Office official (The Office star Patrick Baladi) - but Walker and Carol discover the government worker has secrets of his own to hide. Peggy turns detective after an old note found among a dead friend's belongings raises questions about her husband's disappearance. With Jonathan Kerrigan and Lisa Kay

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The doctor has his second GMC assessment - mock surgery - and Buddy is missing. Meanwhile, Ken's arrival does not bring good news for Al and Bert, and Penhale unhappy with the arrival of his predecessor, Mark Mylow, who tries to take charge of his investigation. Starring Martin Clunes, Caroline Catz and Ian McNeice

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The acerbic GP investigates after local farmer Dennis Thorpe shoots at Robert for taking some of his eggs. Meanwhile, Emily returns to the surgery to see Martin after her acne medication caused a bad reaction, a secret bidder buys the Crab and Lobster pub, and Louisa ponders if she should see a fertility specialist

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: An FBI agent crosses swords with Poirot while trying to retrieve the American Navy's top-secret plans for a new submarine, which have been stolen by a glamorous nightclub singer with a sideline in espionage. Drama, starring David Suchet

programme.title: The Suspect
programme.desc: Having finally uncovered the truth, Joe now faces the challenge of convincing those around him before it is too late, while DI Ruiz takes a calculated risk. Will it pay off, or backfire horribly? At the moment Joe thinks he is finally out of the woods, the stakes suddenly become life or death. Can his skills as a psychologist get him out of trouble one more time?

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: Bodie and Doyle are asked to investigate an incident dating back to 1953 after a death-bed confession reveals the key witness in a major corruption trial did not commit suicide as was believed, but was murdered by the police officers assigned to protect her. Drama, starring Martin Shaw and Lewis Collins

programme.title: The Saint
programme.desc: Simon Templar investigates the murder of a journalist friend, following a trail of clues that leads to a cult obsessed with the splendour and savagery of ancient Rome. Drama, guest starring Peter Wyngarde and Ed Bishop

programme.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: A valuable gem is stolen from the Countess of Morcar, leading the famous detective into a bizarre investigation involving a recovered Christmas goose. Mystery, starring Jeremy Brett, David Burke and Ken Campbell

programme.desc: Coverage of stage five, featuring a 192.4km route starting and finishing in Felixstowe. Presented by Matt Barbet with commentary from Ned Boulting and David Millar

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: Doyle is approached by a woman desperate to prove her imprisoned father is innocent of murder. programme.title: World of Sport
programme.desc: Richard Henwood looks back at television sporting firsts, including footage of a 14-year-old Ronnie O'Sullivan who would go on to take snooker by storm

programme.desc: Action from stage five, featuring a 192.4km route starting and finishing in Felixstowe. Presented by Matt Barbet with commentary from Ned Boulting and David Millar

programme.title: Cycling: Tour of Britain Live
programme.desc: Coverage of stage six, featuring a 146.2km route from Southend-on-Sea to Harlow. After rolling out from Southend's Western Esplanade, in the shadows of the city's historic pier, the first 65 kilometres loop around the towns of Rochford, South Woodham Ferrers, and Burnham-on-Crouch, offering fans the opportunity to catch the peloton at multiple locations. Presented by Matt Barbet with commentary from Ned Boulting and David Millar

programme.title: Sport Filler Shows (2020)
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin introduces some of the great racehorses of the modern era, including Nijinsky, Tiger Roll, Best Mate, Desert Orchid and Shergar

programme.title: Made in Britain
programme.desc: Featuring a master baker creating Eccles cakes with a twist, craftsmen turning hides into handcrafted saddles, Sheffield scissors makers and Britain's only piano factory

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Terry agrees to protect an ex-convict who is being targeted by former partners wanting a share of money stolen during a bank heist. Meanwhile, Arthur resorts to devious tactics to obtain the location of the stashed loot first. Dennis Waterman and George Cole star

programme.title: The Motorbike Show
programme.desc: Henry Cole goes riding in the Yorkshire Dales and tells the story of American motorcycle brand Indian. He also begins the rebuild of his vintage BSA Goldstar

programme.title: BattleBots
programme.desc: The tension is rising as teams desperately fight for survival - needing a win to stand a chance of qualifying for the Championship. Slick-driving Whiplash looks to get its aspirations back on track against Gruff's formidable flame-throwers. Meanwhile, lovable newcomer Rusty - who is built out of scrap metal - tries to shock the world with an upset over distinguished UK veteran Beta

programme.title: Cycling: Tour of Britain Highlights
programme.desc: Action from stage six, featuring a 146.2km route from Southend-on-Sea to Harlow. Presented by Matt Barbet with commentary from Ned Boulting and David Millar

programme.title: All Elite Wrestling: Dynamite
programme.desc: Hard-hitting action from the world of All Elite Wrestling - the roster features world-class talent including Jon Moxley, Chris Jericho, Bryan Danielson and Claudio Castagnoli, and many more who bring a freshness and energy into professional wrestling

programme.title: The Client (1994)
programme.desc: A Mafia lawyer tells a boy where a politician's body is buried shortly before committing suicide, prompting a team of district attorneys to press the young witness for information. However, the streetwise kid refuses to give evidence unless his own and his family's safety is guaranteed, and hires a lawyer to ensure his demands are met. Courtroom thriller based on the novel by John Grisham, with Susan Sarandon, Tommy Lee Jones and Brad Renfro

programme.desc: Animation following the friendship between spirited rabbit Pip and sweet-natured mouse Posy

programme.desc: There's a monster in Paddington's room - and Mrs Bird takes him on a monster hunt

programme.desc: Mr and Mrs Dazzle give Chip a pair of rollerskates and she wants to try them out right away, but learning a new skill takes practice and time

programme.desc: Lofty, Milo and Lark are given the responsibility of becoming judges while Judge Jackson is called away to referee a football match

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Rocky and the Pups are fixing an Old-Timey Junk Car for Ace Sorensen's Birthday

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Nanny Plum and the Wise Old Elf compete to build a boat that will beat the Marigolds

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Madame Gazelle shows Peppa and her friends how to make a time capsule, so they decide to bury one of their own and dig up an old one which their parents made when they were little. Animated series following the adventures of a little pig called Peppa, her brother George, Mummy Pig, Daddy Pig and their friends and family

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: George and Peppa spend the day at the beach, where they have fun playing in the rock pools

programme.title: Milkshake! Story Den
programme.desc: Join Kemi in the Story Den to read The Day Fin Flooded the World

programme.title: Jeremy Vine
programme.desc: The broadcaster and guests discuss the issues of the day, with co-host Storm Huntley joining him for phone-ins and reading out viewers' correspondence

programme.title: Storm Huntley
programme.desc: Debate on the day's talking points continues with Storm Huntley, who takes viewers calls on the biggest stories

programme.title: Alexis Conran
programme.desc: The actor, writer and broadcaster examines the important stories of the day, getting viewers' opinions and views on them

programme.title: 5 News at Lunchtime
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Kirby walks out on Leah, vowing to quit her job at the Diner. Theo, Justin and Leah agree that they have all made a bad situation worse

programme.title: Cradle Did Fall (2021)
programme.desc: A woman invites a photographer to her house to take pictures of her baby, and the two form a friendship, but the mother suspects the photographer drugged her and was planning to steal her child. Thriller, starring Ali Liebert, Lauren K Robek and Matreya Scarrwener

programme.title: The Cruise: Fun-Loving Brits at Sea
programme.desc: The three groups visit the beautiful Greek island of Mykonos, where mum and son Julie and Rocco head straight to the aptly named Paradise Beach

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: Susan Calman's Grand Day Out
programme.desc: The comedian climbs the dramatic and spectacular peaks of north Wales. She she stops off at the must-see tourist spot of the Tu Hwnt Ir Bont Tearoom, said to be the most photographed in Wales and famed for its Welsh rarebit. Moving on to Mount Snowdon, Susan climbs the magnificent peak in style, using the mountain railway

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: Inside
programme.desc: Documentary looking at how the German supermarket has succeeded in the UK, overcoming industry hostility and old-fashioned snobbery to win the public over with its discounted goods. Former staff reveal how Aldi has overcome shoppers' suspicions using a host of clever techniques to cut costs, from multiple barcodes and less time spent at the tills, to their own-brand products - which are intended to look and taste like their big-name counterparts, but cost a fraction of the price

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: Puppy School for Guide Dogs
programme.desc: Cameras reveal how Ela and her pups - including Kinky, with the broken tail - are getting on. Puppy midwife Tim is keeping an eye on Ela's weight loss, but the youngsters are thriving. At puppy school, trainee guide dog Milton tries to use a pedestrian crossing

programme.title: Jane McDonald: Lost in Japan
programme.desc: The presenter explores Kyoto, a place of beautiful shrines and temples, atmospheric tea ceremonies and geishas dressed in exquisite kimonos. Arriving in the city via the super-fast bullet train, Jane decides a slower-paced form of transport would be more appropriate, so takes a rikshaw ride around the city before coming to a stop in a beautiful bamboo forest

programme.title: Million Pound Motorhomes
programme.desc: Debbie McGee and her sister Donna take a trip down memory lane to the beach at Littlehampton that they used to visit as children, but this time in a motorhome. Kate Birch and her team adapt motorhomes to make them wheelchair accessible, from fitting lifts and hoists, to widening doorways and adding steering wheel hand controls. A customer pops in with a broken wheelchair lift, which he needs fixed to go to a dog show with his wife. Can the team mend it in time?

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: Rip stumbles upon a dangerous and desperate situation and a plan is set in motion designed to squeeze John Dutton and threaten his way of life. Meanwhile, Monica begins a tough recovery

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc: Cheshire Police's elite team of officers crack down on some of Britain's most serious driving offenders. PCs Ian Cosgrove and Rich Woodward attend the scene of a shocking multi-vehicle crash on the M56 that has left a woman trapped in a car, while Inspector Anton Sullivan enlists the help of PCs Niaz Waddington and Amy Hollis to pull a stolen car over. Nick Campbell narrates

programme.title: The Golden Voyage of Sinbad (1974)
programme.desc: A swashbuckling sailor stumbles across a golden tablet that forms part of a map revealing the way to a magic fountain, which is fabled to bestow untold riches and eternal youth. But first the brave mariner has to battle storms, monsters and the trickery of an evil wizard before he can reach his goal. Fantasy adventure, with John Phillip Law, Tom Baker, Douglas Wilmer, Martin Shaw and Caroline Munro, with effects by Ray Harryhausen

programme.title: Attack! (1956)
programme.desc: An American infantry lieutenant fighting in German-occupied Belgium is convinced an inept but well-connected officer is not fit for command. When his unit are wiped out after another of the officer's mistakes, the lieutenant miraculously survives and returns to base seeking revenge. Second World War drama, starring Jack Palance, Eddie Albert, Lee Marvin, Buddy Ebsen and Robert Strauss

programme.title: Young Winston (1972)
programme.desc: Biopic of Winston Churchill, following the future prime minister's formative years. While working as a journalist, he travels to Africa to report on the Boer Wars, an assignment that leads to his incarceration in a prison camp. He escapes from captivity and returns to England to begin a political career. Directed by Richard Attenborough and starring Simon Ward, Anthony Hopkins, Anne Bancroft and Robert Shaw

programme.title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World (2003)
programme.desc: The captain of a British warship engages in a tense battle of wits and an escalating test of nerves with a French counterpart during the Napoleonic conflict, a pursuit that takes his crew on a dangerous journey along the coast of South America. Seafaring drama, adapted from Patrick O'Brian's novels, starring Russell Crowe, Paul Bettany, James D'Arcy, Billy Boyd and Edward Woodall

programme.title: The Fence (2022)
programme.desc: During the 1980s, a kid from a Bristolian council estate sets out to make good with a gang of local thieves. Writer/diector William Stone's comedy drama, starring Sally Phillips, David Perkins and Eugene Simon

programme.title: The Hitman's Bodyguard (2017)
programme.desc: A disgraced bodyguard is hired to protect a hitman about to testify against the tyrannical president of Belarus at the International Criminal Court in exchange for the release of his wife from prison. Comedy action thriller, starring Ryan Reynolds, Samuel L Jackson, Gary Oldman and Salma Hayek

programme.title: Les Enfants du Siecle (1999)
programme.desc: Fact-based period drama chronicling the turbulent and ultimately doomed love affair between poet Alfred de Musset and early feminist writer George Sand, who went on to enjoy a lengthy and well-documented relationship with composer Chopin. Starring Juliette Binoche, Benoit Magimel and Stefano Dionisi. In French

programme.title: Von Ryan's Express (1965)
programme.desc: A courageous American colonel with a never-say-die attitude is held in a PoW camp. He boldly sets out to lead a group of Allied prisoners in a daring mass escape bid by hijacking a freight train and fleeing through occupied Italy to Switzerland. Second World War action adventure, starring Frank Sinatra, Trevor Howard, Brad Dexter and James Brolin

programme.title: Operation Petticoat (1959)
programme.desc: A Second World War submarine captain tries to restore his crippled vessel to its former glory, but is thwarted by his first officer, who has invited a party of nurses, children and an expectant mother on board. Mayhem ensues as the skipper struggles to rein in the female influence on ship protocol. Comedy, starring Cary Grant, Tony Curtis and Joan O'Brien

programme.title: The Sons of Katie Elder (1965)
programme.desc: Four brothers are reunited at their mother's funeral and discover their father was swindled out of his farm and subsequently murdered. However, as they set about avenging his death and reclaiming his land, a crook frames them for killing the sheriff. Western, starring John Wayne, Dean Martin, Earl Holliman, Michael Anderson Jr, James Gregory, George Kennedy and Dennis Hopper

programme.title: Catch Me If You Can (2002)
programme.desc: The story of Frank Abagnale Jr, who found notoriety as a teenager conning and charming his way across America. Posing as a pilot, a doctor and a lawyer, Frank was able to fund an extravagant lifestyle while outwitting the FBI at every turn. Fact-based drama, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Tom Hanks, Christopher Walken, Martin Sheen and James Brolin

programme.title: 3:10 to Yuma (2007)
programme.desc: A rancher seizes the chance to settle his debts and earn his son's respect by agreeing to escort a notorious outlaw to the town of Contention, where a train will take the prisoner to jail. But the journey takes a dangerous turn when the criminal tries to manipulate the rancher into letting him go - while his henchmen lie in wait. Western remake, starring Russell Crowe, Christian Bale and Gretchen Mol

programme.title: Man on Fire (2004)
programme.desc: A former US government operative battling with an addiction to alcohol is hired as a bodyguard to the nine-year-old daughter of a wealthy businessman in Mexico City. When the girl is abducted, he swears vengeance on those responsible while setting out on a dangerous, revenge-fuelled rescue mission. Action thriller, starring Denzel Washington, Christopher Walken, Radha Mitchell and Dakota Fanning

programme.title: Von Ryan's Express (1965)
programme.desc: A courageous American colonel with a never-say-die attitude is held in a PoW camp. He boldly sets out to lead a group of Allied prisoners in a daring mass escape bid by hijacking a freight train and fleeing through occupied Italy to Switzerland. Second World War action adventure, starring Frank Sinatra, Trevor Howard, Brad Dexter and James Brolin

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Lazy Boy Garage
programme.desc: Jonny thinks he can turn a profit on the relatively unknown Seat 600 and purchases one from Barcelona, as the Lazy Boys try to tap into the market for bubble cars

programme.title: Lazy Boy Garage
programme.desc: Jonny Smith finds an Austrian Ford Cortina Mk4, known in Europe as the Taunus, but the Lazy Boys need to decide whether to replace its rare engine

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Paddy McGuiness, Chris Harris and Freddie Flintoff go on a road trip in a trio of affordable second-hand convertibles. On the test track, Chris puts the new Ariel Atom through its paces, while Freddie goes bungee jumping off a dam in an old Rover

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles travels to Warrington, Cheshire, to meet electrician Dave McCartney, a healthy man until he had a stroke at work that has left him partially paralysed. Now he is forced to sleep in a hospital bed in his kitchen - but it won't be for much longer, as his old workmates team up with the DIY SOS builders and other members of the local community to adapt his home to his needs, with designer Charlie Luxton on hand to keep the boys in check

programme.title: Exploration Volcano
programme.desc: Chris journeys to Iceland to install vital early-warning systems on one of the country's most dangerous volcanoes - the glacier-covered monster Katla

programme.title: Jack Stein: Born to Cook
programme.desc: A local guide takes Jack island-hopping to find some of the world's most pristine oyster beds. He attempts to catch mud crabs, before using a chef's trick to source the produce

programme.title: Jack Stein: Born to Cook
programme.desc: In the season finale, Jack honours the people and food he has encountered in Kimberley with a long-table dinner under the stars

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly and the bidders are looking for treasure in Somerset's storage units, where a bouncy castle and an air boat are among the finds

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Heavy D is in town and is prepared to risk having his fingers burned for the chance of a big score, while auctioneer Sean Kelly keeps a watchful eye

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: James looks at some of the advances in motoring that never caught on, revealing how the petrol engine came to dominate in the 20th century, while concepts for jet engines and steam power fell by the wayside. He also drives an amphibious car and an electric scooter, and takes a ride in the world's fastest driverless car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May build their own versions of motorhomes and set off for a bank holiday weekend in the West Country to try out their creations in the real world. The Audi R8 V10 Spyder also takes on the Porsche 911 Turbo Cabriolet on the test track, and American actor Andy Garcia does a lap in the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Paddy McGuiness, Chris Harris and Freddie Flintoff go on a road trip in a trio of affordable second-hand convertibles. On the test track, Chris puts the new Ariel Atom through its paces, while Freddie goes bungee jumping off a dam in an old Rover

programme.title: Cannonball
programme.desc: Andrew Flintoff presents highlights from the first series of the action-packed game show, in which 24 contestants are tasked with traversing a series of water-based challenges and custom-made inflatable obstacles, each designed to test speed, accuracy, height and distance. With contributions from regulars Frankie Bridge, Radzi Chinyanganya, Ryan Hand and Maya Jama

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef journeys along the Etang de Thau, famous for its oysters and mussels, before mooring his barge in the port of Sete, where Bastille Day is being celebrated. He also rustles up seafood ragout and roast black bream before travelling on to Marseille to tackle the most famous fish dish of all - bouillabaisse

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef's epic journey from the Atlantic to the Mediterranean comes to an end as he takes the final leg of his gastronomic tour along the canal systems of southern France. Arriving in Marseille, he samples seafood and regional cuisine, as well as showing a variety of traditional recipes. He also cooks roast black bream and finds time to send Chalky a postcard

programme.title: Rick Stein's Spain
programme.desc: The chef continues his culinary tour in Castile - a region famous not only for its vast plains and castles but also as the home of 11th-century military leader El Cid - before heading to La Mancha, an area renowned for its rustic dishes and wine production, as well as being the land of Miguel de Cervantes' literary character Don Quixote

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall, Jodie Kidd, Jamali Maddix and Suzi Perry test their general knowledge skills, and the winner of the week's games is announced

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Comedians Ellie Taylor and Josh Widdicombe, actor and writer Steve Pemberton and presenter Fern Britton take part in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Question master Stephen Fry continues the comedy panel quiz's exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he asks a range of fiendish questions about lenses, lungs and legs. With comedian and The Last Leg co-host Josh Widdicombe, comedienne Jo Brand, Never Mind the Buzzcocks team captain and stand-up Phill Jupitus and regular panellist Alan Davies

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by birdwatcher Bill Oddie and comedians Frank Skinner, Jon Richardson and Sarah Millican on the comedy panel show. Rob Brydon chairs as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon presents, as regular team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by one-time Bake Off champion Nadiya Hussain, comic and actor Michael Smiley, and comedians Bob Mortimer and Diane Morgan. As usual, the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory and the dubious honour of being dubbed the liar of the week

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by radio presenter Sara Cox, comedian Jason Manford, journalist Nick Robinson and actor Harry Shearer, who aim to help the team captains deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis are joined by an array of guests in a special edition of the show, featuring a look back at the year gone by as well as out-takes and all the usual fun

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis are back with the topical comedy show. Together with guests Maisie Adam, Angela Barnes, Rhys James, Eshaan Akbar and Alasdair Beckett-King, they'll be poking fun at the recent headlines

programme.desc: The discovery of a wreck off the coast of Florida sends a team of underwater explorers on a mission to discover the identity of a ship that simply shouldn't exist

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: Exploring hidden defences that have kept Cork Harbour, in Ireland, safe for over 400 years. Plus, a former submarine base in the fjords of northern Norway

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Eerie ruins hiding in the forested hills of Arkansas, USA, and a disintegrating gulag in Albania that housed enemies of the state

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A volcanic island just off Taiwan containing chilling ruins from its darkest era, and a miniature railway that lies forgotten in the woods of Arkansas

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: A secret weapons program in the heart of Austria that could have ended badly for the Allies - and may have indicated nuclear plans being concocted by Hitler

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War II
programme.desc: First hand accounts of America's opening air raid on the Japanese archipelago, led by Colonel Jimmy Doolittle

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo uses his 1913 copy of Bradshaw's Continental Railway Guide to venture beyond Europe as he travels through the Holy Land. He begins in Israel, learning about the Baha'i faith and how it spread to Britain in the Edwardian era, hearing the story of the origins of Tel Aviv, and visiting the Christian, Jewish and Muslim quarters of the capital Jerusalem. Michael then crosses the separation barrier between Jerusalem and the West Bank in the company of his Palestinian guide and meets the embroiderers of the Arab Women's Union in Bethlehem, before finishing his journey in the Negev desert

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce returns to BBC Caversham, near Reading, where objects brought in to be valued include a communion book that was originally owned by war poet Wilfred Owen, an Aston Martin sports car, and a finely embroidered 17th-century needlework box that creates a surprise when its value is revealed

programme.title: Bangers & Cash
programme.desc: Derek collects a beautifully restored and carefully modified 1936 Wolseley 14/56. Meanwhile, a Batman-inspired Chrysler Crossfire is dropped off at the Thornton le Dale garage

programme.title: Bangers & Cash
programme.desc: Paul's doing the pick-ups in Lancashire where a rare 1960 Vauxhall Cresta PA Friary estate in dusky pink awaits

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War II
programme.desc: Stories of people who came close to losing their lives during the Second World War, beginning with tales about the Chindits, the army's elite jungle troops division who beat the Japanese in a daring mission

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: Guided missiles, the Wasserfall, and the war-changing V2 were dreamed up and tested in Peenemunde, a German seaside city suddenly overtaken by Nazi elite

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the next leg of his journey, Michael Portillo heads along the Essex bank of the Thames before crossing the river into Kent. He begins in Barkingside, where Victorian philanthropist Thomas Barnardo made it his mission to transform the lives of destitute children. The former politician then tries his hand at loading a container onto a pocket wagon at Tilbury docks, and ends his trip in Rochester, where he encounters a host of familiar characters and explores a town that was an inspiration for many of Charles Dickens' works

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo starts the next leg of his journey to Chichester in Faversham, Kent, where he visits Shepherd Neame, which is one of the oldest breweries in Britain. He then heads to Dover to explore a sunken fortress known as the Western Heights, before crossing into Surrey where he blow-dries a hen in Dorking

programme.title: Bangers & Cash
programme.desc: An Aston Martin DB6 in need of total restoration looks set to break the Mathewsons auction record and news of a rare Vincent motorbike arriving causes a stir

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Philadelphia, and pays tribute to its fictional son, Rocky Balboa. He finishes the latest leg of his journey in Gettysburg, the most famous battlefield of the American Civil War, where President Abraham Lincoln made a momentous speech in 1863

programme.title: Ireland with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Two-part programme exploring the history of both the Republic of Ireland and Northern Ireland and examining the rich culture and troubled past. In the first episode, Simon arrives by ferry in Co Wexford and travels along the coast, joining the thousands who try to climb the sacred mountain of Croagh Patrick. He crosses the border to visit Crom Castle and Londonderry, before journeying to the northernmost point at Malin Head

programme.desc: Divers search a newly discovered wreck as they investigate the story of the SS Justicia, sunk in the First World War by U-Boats off the coast of Ireland

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: Exploring a former gold mine turned scientific laboratory in South Dakota. Plus, limestone tunnels in London and a former water cistern in Denmark

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The home of an African dictator and a sporting hero, and the facility that held apartheid's greatest critic are abandoned, but still have unique stories to tell

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring a ghost town in Colorado, the remnants of an industrial enterprise in Puerto Rico and a remote village on Cyprus

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: Germany's preparations for WW2 began years before 1939. Under various guises, Germany began work on what would become their most technologically advanced front

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War II
programme.desc: The bravery of the 333rd Field Artillery Battalion, a depleted unit of African-American soldiers who risked everything to fight off the Nazis at Bastogne, Belgium

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his trusty 1913 Bradshaw's Continental Railway Guide, Michael Portillo travels east through the Balkans along the most exotic section of the route taken by the Orient Express. His journey begins in Sofia, capital of Bulgaria, and includes stops in the ancient city of Plovdiv, the region of Rumelia, and former capital of the Ottoman Empire Edirne. Arriving in Istanbul, Michael takes a trip on the Bosphorus - a much-coveted stretch of water - finds out about Turkish delight and travels along the Marmaray metro line, which connects European and Asian Istanbul via a tunnel beneath the Bosphorus

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce introduces a selection of unscreened items from recent shows. Among the fascinating finds are a garnet and diamond cross believed by the owner to have been gifted by Marie Antoinette en route to the guillotine, and a suitcase of unopened letters from an imprisoned First World War soldier that finally reveal their secrets. Plus, an arts-and-crafts casket once intended to be the final resting place of a woman's ashes

programme.title: Bangers & Cash
programme.desc: Dave's in fast car heaven as he picks up a rare Subaru Impreza and an equally powerful Ford Escort RS Cosworth from North Wales

programme.title: Bangers & Cash
programme.desc: A rare 1968 Honda N600 car emerges from a lock up in County Durham and Derek's in Scotland to collect an original RAC Bedford van

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War II
programme.desc: The story of Major General Robert Laycock who rallied his ill-equipped troops to see off a German attack on Crete, Greece

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: In Poland lies a forgotten Nazi complex which could have sheltered up to 27,244 people from Allied bombs, the purpose of which largely remains a mystery

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey through southern Scotland, with this leg beginning in the industrial town of Greenock, from where he sets sail in the world's last sea-going paddle steamer. He then sees the devastating effects of a fire at the Glasgow School of Art, heads to Blantyre to find out about the humble beginnings of a famous missionary and explorer and learns to make sourdough in a bakery in Strathaven before finishing his trip in Larkhall

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo sets off from Motherwell as he continues his journey through southern Scotland, celebrating the Victorian iron and steel industry and admires one of its crowning achievements - the Forth Rail Bridge. He then visits the Falls of Clyde, which inspired Wordsworth and Coleridge, heads to Cumbernauld to learn about the origins of one of Scotland's best-selling soft drinks, and in Linlithgow he marvels at the ingenuity of the engineers who built the Union Canal

programme.title: Bangers & Cash
programme.desc: Derek auctions off some vehicles that were used in the TV show Heartbeat. There's love for an Austin Cambridge and a sporty Italian number finds a new home

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.desc: The Liverpool and Manchester Railway, which revolutionised rail travel when it opened in 1830, becoming the first railway to have a signalling system among many other things

programme.title: Bangers & Cash
programme.desc: Dave's in Lincolnshire picking up a 1935 Riley Falcon - a good-looking saloon car, with a pre-select gearbox

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The design and manufacture of tank-piercing 'super bullets', and the creation of dentists' drills

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry and Sam are in Suffolk with Barry and his vintage bikes. Henry has his eyes on a few petrol pumps, but Sam has other ideas when he sees Barry's collection of sidecars

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Dominic Chinea uses his expertise to make a dilapidated and unsafe go-kart roadworthy once again. Kirsten Ramsay faces an unusual challenge in the shape of a papier mache cat

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike makes a deal over some taxidermy animals and spots a retro billboard that could be worth a lot of money

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The team heads to Ron's Illinois home - teeming with taxidermy, it's Pet Sematary meets the Natural History Museum

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini advises on how to sell an exceptional car collection, including a Mercedes 500K and a 1922 Mercer

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini prepares to attend the Pris d'LeMons car exhibition, and hopes his Volvo P18 Wagon will stand out among the vehicles on show

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: A 1917 Overland becomes FantomWorks' oldest restoration, while Dan buys a 1968 Camaro on the internet and decides to build it as a present for his wife

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: The green-fingered team returns with more surprise garden makeovers for deserving people across the nation. Darren and Lesley Chan's youngest daughter Amelie was born with Charge syndrome - a debilitating genetic condition that has left her deaf, partially sighted and in need of constant care. Alan Titchmarsh sets out to transform the Manchester family's neglected outdoor space, calling in David Domoney, Frances Tophill and Katie Rushworth to introduce sensory planting for the 10-year-old, a shade-loving border and a multifunction pathway made from areas of decking, artificial turf and paving

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph gets creative with a mannequin at Earlswood Recycling Centre, while restorers Neil Wragg and Rachel Henderson get to work on some sofa leather and an old metal trunk

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Dominic Chinea uses his expertise to make a dilapidated and unsafe go-kart roadworthy once again. Kirsten Ramsay faces an unusual challenge in the shape of a papier mache cat

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to a private railway, where Simon converts a lantern to a stylish table and Henry turns a fire extinguisher into a steampunk lamp

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: At a Catholic church in Liverpool, Drew Pritchard's prayers are answered with a pair of very rare chairs. In Leicestershire, he finds industrial gems in the world's largest bell foundry

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: French polisher Alex tries to piece a grand Tudor style four poster bed back together. Drew asks sculptor Nick to rescue a pair of decorative corbels

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike and Ant welcome a 1968 International Harvester Travelall to the workshop, that is an ancestor of the modern SUV

programme.title: Cycling: Vuelta a Espana
programme.desc: Action from stage 13, from Huesca la Magia to Col du Tourmalet

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew and Tee travel to four extraordinary locations across Northern Italy, including the country's most famed antique markets and a dreamy Tuscan villa

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: North West Ambulance Service calls up military personnel to help care for the public effectively as the pandemic takes its toll. The new recruits are put through three days of intensive training before they can join the paramedics working on the frontline. Once training is complete they should be able to respond to lower category calls, which account for 20 per cent of the workload. In control, call handlers are currently answering a new 999 call every 20 seconds. With staff sickness taking its toll on the workforce, agency staff are drafted in to help. Narrated by Christopher Eccleston

programme.title: Helicopter ER
programme.desc: The Yorkshire Air Ambulance crew is called to an accident after four people lose control of a stolen lorry, resulting in multiple injuries

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How the world's largest passenger airliner - the A380 - is serviced, and the process of building and tuning a piano to concert standards

programme.title: How Do They Do It?

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Buyer Mike Brewer tracks down a Lincoln Continental, which set new style standards for luxury sedans in the 1960s. However, tastes have changed, and mechanic Edd China hatches a refurb plan

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Edinburgh, Christian radio DJ and gospel singer Eloho, hopes to take her guests to church, gospel-style, with a music-filled evening. She's also hoping her traditional Nigerian fare will serve up all things spice and nice to her rivals. Her guests are cabin crew trainer Julie, IT manager and occasional stand-up comic Ryan, cab driver Jamie and business owner and socialite Maz

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the second night in Edinburgh, cabin crew trainer Julie plans an evening of Scottish fine dining, starting with her grandmother's cullen skink, followed by lamb shank

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: IT manager and stand-up comic Ryan hosts the third dinner party of the week in Edinburgh, hoping to impress his guests with a menu designed by a friend who is a Michelin Star chef

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Taxi driver Jamie serves up a fine dining menu in Edinburgh but the table chat does not go down well with some and Eloho is unimpressed with the host's silent-disco strip-tease

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the final night in Edinburgh, business owner and socialite Maz is determined that a fantastic fondue, a slap-up portion of posh fish and chips and a handsome Highland piper will be enough to see her become the belle of the ball, capturing the 1,000 prize

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Danni Menzies jets off to Portugal's Setbal Peninsula to help house-hunters Tony and Hendrik from York find their dream holiday home on a budget of 330,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

With a budget of 115,000 Danni Menzies gives them a real dilemma, as they have to decide between not just one but three strong contenders

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The architect meets a Yorkshire couple who plan to transform a goods wagon into a summerhouse and gin bar, and visits a narrowboat conversion in Buckinghamshire. programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: IT manager Bea is the first to host in Gloucestershire, hoping an international menu inspired by her travels will impress her guests and set her on the way to winning the prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the last night in Gloucestershire, hairdresser Lorna hopes an American '50s diner-style menu will be a success. programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: At Chteau du Doux in the Dordogne region, bad weather threatens to derail Abbie, Clive and Karen's first wedding of the year. Elsewhere, in the Loire Valley, Ben and Billie near the end of the renovation of their two guest apartments. Ben has his work cut out to put up a chandelier with no lighting fixture, while Billie attempts to paint new life into old furniture

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jean Johansson helps Gary and Jan find their dream holiday home in southwest France. Armed with a budget of 140,000 the group search the countryside of Haute-Vienne for a detached house with lots of outdoor space and a pool where they can spend several months of the year enjoying the great outdoors with their families

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps sisters Sheila and Jean from Nottingham find their dream holiday home, which they can enjoy with their family and friends in and around Spain's Mijas Costa

programme.title: The Dog House

It is hoped his spruced-up look will convince the Bradford family that age is just a number

When a 19-year-old is treated for injuries sustained in a motorbike crash, his mother reflects on leaving her children in Colombia in search of a better life for them abroad. Other patients include a builder with an ankle injury sustained playing basketball, and a 72-year-old with a suspected stroke

programme.title: Traffic Cops

programme.title: Police Interceptors

programme.title: Police Interceptors

programme.title: NCIS

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A nuclear power plant inspector suffers radiation poisoning, forcing the team to consider the possibility that a foreign power deliberately targeted him. programme.desc: A notorious radio DJ claims to have survived an attack by two men posing as chauffeurs. However, proving the Mafia's involvement depends on a number of unreliable or unavailable witnesses. Dennis Farina and Jesse L Martin star

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A jeweller with ties to the Russian Mob is shot dead in the middle of Times Square. It emerges that he had been helping the authorities bring his associates to justice, giving the detectives some obvious suspects. However, another man injured in the gunfire is later identified as one of the two shooters, bringing his accomplice and then the dead man's wife under suspicion

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Detectives Fontana and Green investigate the murders of a group of heroin users in a raid on a drug den. The prime suspect is a warlord who aided American forces in Afghanistan and claims diplomatic immunity - but McCoy and Southerlyn refuse to be swayed in their attempts to prosecute. Drama, starring Dennis Farina, Jesse L Martin, Sam Waterston and Elisabeth Rohm

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Paramedics become suspicious about a baby's death, calling in Briscoe and Curtis, who discover the parents adopted the child from an illegal Russian ring. The case takes on another dimension altogether when it transpires that the crooks specialise in placing terminally ill infants with unsuspecting families. Starring Jerry Orbach and Benjamin Bratt

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: McCoy and Carmichael have the unenviable task of prosecuting three police officers with a racially motivated hate crime that threatens to cause uproar in the city. Police drama, starring Sam Waterston and Angie Harmon

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A narcotics detective plans a major drugs sting but makes the mistake of illegally using a teenager as bait - with fatal consequences. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Benjamin Bratt

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The unit is called to examine the mysterious death of a sailor serving on a research vessel engaged in a top-secret mission. Drama, starring David McCallum, Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Lauren Holly

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A childhood friend of Gibbs' dead daughter is stalked by a marine who recently returned from Iraq, and asks the agent for help. Memories of his murdered family lead him to make the case a priority, but he acts on his initiative and leaves HQ without his badge, making DiNozzo fear he is risking his job for a personal vendetta. Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly star

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A taxi driver and an admiral working at the Pentagon are found executed by the side of a road, but the agents have trouble ascertaining a motive - until they uncover links to a woman searching for her missing husband, a political refugee from Africa. Meanwhile, McGee makes a discovery about his new girlfriend. Starring Sean Murray, Michael Weatherly and Mark Harmon

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny enters New York's Hasidic community to investigate the murder of the man recently appointed its leader - only to find the victim led a complicated personal life. Jamie arrests the former mayor's daughter for smoking drugs in public, and her bad attitude leaves Erin unable to help her, while Henry upsets Frank by revealing a family secret. Police drama, starring Donnie Wahlberg, Tom Selleck and Bridget Moynahan

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The team hunt for a predator who uses a date-rape drug that leaves no evidence. Meanwhile, Rollins receives some good news

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

programme.title: NCIS

Determined to clear his name in full, Friedgen volunteers to be court-martialled, on the condition that the NCIS team conducts its own investigation. Meanwhile, Bishop and Jake discuss their marital problems. Naval crime drama, starring Emily Wickersham, with Jamie Bamber

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The two Marine brothers of a sailor battling leukaemia are killed in the line of duty, and to spare the servicemen's family further grief, the secretary of the US Navy seeks the NCIS team's help in locating a suitable bone marrow donor. Meanwhile, Bishop returns home to Oklahoma for Thanksgiving. Military crime drama, starring Emily Wickersham

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Ducky is assaulted by a man who claims to have previously undisclosed information about his half-brother, who died decades ago. While his NCIS colleagues traces the attacker's whereabouts, Dr Mallard recalls the emotional final days he spent with his sibling. Elsewhere, as the holiday season approaches, Bishop and Jake discuss the future of their relationship. Naval crime drama, starring David McCallum

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The first instalment of a two-part crossover with NCIS: New Orleans sees the Washington, DC team co-operating with their colleagues from the Big Easy to investigate a spate of lethal poisonings on board a New Orleans-to-DC flight. All the evidence seems to point to missing chef Luca, who happens to be Abby's brother, so the two investigative services join forces to locate him, and find out why a private tech firm seems to have been targetted by the killer. Naval crime drama, guest starring Scott Bakula

programme.desc: Met Police helicopter India 99 is called to help rescue a woman who jumped into the Thames near the Palace of Westminster, as well as her two daughters, who leapt in after her. Elsewhere, the helicopter team coordinates a risky game of cat-and-mouse as police chase a group of graffiti artists across live train tracks in a patch of industrial wasteland in Battersea. The episode also looks at the case of the Hounslow Slasher, a man who in 2012 randomly attacked lone women while they were travelling home at night. Nick Wallis presents

programme.desc: Briscoe and Curtis investigate the murder of a doctor at a fertility clinic, but are embroiled in a dispute between two women over the ownership of frozen embryos. Police drama, starring Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A traumatised marine escapes from a psychiatric unit, convinced he is still fighting in Iraq. The agents believe his erratic behaviour indicates post-traumatic stress disorder and try to calmly talk him round before restraining him. programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Muslim US Marine is found seemingly shot dead near a mosque that has been linked to an al-Qaeda recruiter. Ducky refuses to perform an autopsy out of respect for the man's religion, but Abby runs tests that reveal his demise was actually due to poisoning from a rare octopus venom. Meanwhile, McGee goes into the mosque intending to plant a concealed microphone - but discovers someone has had the same idea

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and the team set up a stake-out at a storage facility to catch a thief suspected of selling hi-tech Navy equipment on the black market, but end up witnessing a murder. To make matters worse, $90million worth of radar gear goes missing while they are distracted. Meanwhile, Ducky asks Abby to run a series of mysterious blood tests, raising suspicions that he is harbouring a secret

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The squad members are hampered by their own blind spots and a community that is losing trust in the police when they try to solve an assault in Central Park. Action drama, starring Mariska Hargitay, Kelli Giddish and Ice-T

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Rollins and Tamin respond to a dangerous domestic violence call, while Fin gives his deposition in the lawsuit against him. Starring Mariska Hargitay, Kelli Giddish, Ice-T and Jamie Gray Hyder

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team suspects foul play when a seaman who was set to testify before a grand jury dies before he can make his court appearance. When it becomes clear the man was murdered, the subsequent investigation reveals that a previously thwarted human-trafficking ring has been re-established. Meanwhile, a storm causes a massive power outage, and McGee seeks a room for the night among his colleagues. Naval crime drama, starring Sean Murray

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A deep-sea diver is murdered on the job, and his co-workers all become suspects. However, when they return to the surface, they must remain in a high-tech decompression chamber for four days. With each of their suspects confined within a tank, the NCIS team must complete an unorthodox investigation from the outside. Starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: Fantasy Homes by the Sea
programme.desc: Jenni Falconer helps a Northamptonshire couple find their dream coastal home in Italy's Abruzzo region

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping Feature. Your one-stop-shop for all things cruise; bringing you the hottest destinations, ground-breaking ships and the latest deals to ensure your next cruise is your greatest one

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: At a luxury fabric manufacturer in Suffolk, Drew Pritchard is impressed by historic silks once used in the royal household. Plus, in Scotland, he haggles with a young baron

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: At a Catholic church in Liverpool, Drew Pritchard's prayers are answered with a pair of very rare chairs. In Leicestershire, he finds industrial gems in the world's largest bell foundry

programme.title: The Edinburgh Auction House
programme.desc: Sybelle clears a pensioner's home and uncovers a haul of valuable silver. Later in Elgin in Scotland, she finds a collection of Paddington Bears

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Auctioneers Charlie Ross and James Braxton are halfway through their trip, travelling from Shenton in Leicestershire before heading auction in Bourne End, Buckinghamshire

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades scours the recycling centre in Altrincham, Greater Manchester for three unwanted items he can save and sell on. Furniture restyler Chloe Kempster attempts to give an old tallboy a new lease of life, while woodworker Bruce Faulseit has an interesting challenge on his hands with a collection of slate tiles. For his own project, Jay has a trio of metal lights to overhaul

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Scarlette Douglas is in Paphos in Cyprus with couple Pauline and Andy. After getting engaged on the island, the pair would now like to find their own bolthole here to share with their family for extended breaks. With the thought of one day also retiring out here, the pressure is on Scarlette to show them five top properties within their budget of 80,000

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Weighing in at almost 700lbs, 50-year-old Pauline has an addiction to food that is slowly killing her and destroying her son's life as her carer. Can she get back on track?

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: Victoria loves sparkle but doesn't want to be covered in glitter. Meanwhile, Bride Zahra craves an elaborate dress, but she will need a bigger budget

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: Melissa is having a Greek wedding and doesn't want a typical dress. Meanwhile, Naomi seeks a subtly sexy frock but worries what her conservative family will think

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.desc: Officer Sadler discovers what she believes to be fighting cockerels in the back of a pick-up truck, and Lieutenant Scott faces a daring bridge rescue

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: The return of the Bafta-winning documentary, this time following the work of the North West Ambulance Service. The staff and crews face a busy weekend dealing with 11,000 calls as 80,000 fans descend on Manchester for the annual Parklife festival. As the handlers try to prioritise the influx of calls, Andrea and Glynn are diverted from a one-year-old having a seizure to a road traffic accident on a dual carriageway. Meanwhile, Debbie and Shaun try to persuade a homeless man he needs to go to hospital

programme.title: The Edinburgh Auction House
programme.desc: Sybelle makes a valuable find when she discovers a sketch that could be by a renowned artist. Later, a Persian rug surprises everyone on auction day

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Auctioneers Charlie Ross and James Braxton embark on their final leg of their trek. Kicking things off in the Kent village of Brasted they journey through the countryside heading towards Cobham in Surrey. Charlie takes a risky punt on a pricey purchase hoping it will see him sail into the lead at the last auction, but has he done enough to take the road trip crown from rival James?

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Stephanie Connell and Charlie Ross head out from Sevenoaks to an auction at Folkestone, learning the story of the Kent cobnut harvest along the way

programme.title: The Bad Skin Clinic
programme.desc: Dr. Emma Craythorne and her team of experts are on a mission to solve complex skin conditions. They help people whose lives have been impeded by devastating disorders.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress with Tan France
programme.desc: Drag queen Plastiq needs Tan's help to find a dress that makes her feel like a true bride. Plus, bride Abi refuses to wear anything that sparkles

programme.title: Ghost Adventures
programme.desc: Ghost hunters Zak Bagans, Nick Groff and Aaron Goodwin hunt the infamous town of Deadwood for spirits of cowboys and Wild West gunslingers

programme.title: Ghost Hunters
programme.desc: The team investigates a high-society Alabama mansion that was also home to misery and misfortune, with Satori Hawes and Cody DesBiens helping dig up secrets

programme.title: Ghost Adventures
programme.desc: Ghost hunters Zak Bagans, Nick Groff and Aaron Goodwin travel to Soledad, California, to investigate the Los Coches Adobe, a former brothel. When Jay encounters a shadow figure and goes into a panic, the rest of the team rushes in to rescue him from the malevolent spirits

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.desc: Officer Sadler discovers what she believes to be fighting cockerels in the back of a pick-up truck, and Lieutenant Scott faces a daring bridge rescue

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades scours the recycling centre in Altrincham, Greater Manchester for three unwanted items he can save and sell on. Furniture restyler Chloe Kempster attempts to give an old tallboy a new lease of life, while woodworker Bruce Faulseit has an interesting challenge on his hands with a collection of slate tiles. For his own project, Jay has a trio of metal lights to overhaul

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The agents try to track down an arms dealer who has the launch codes for the Navy's encrypted satellite defence system and is offering them to the highest bidder. In an attempt to win the confidence of the buyer, Ducky poses as an ageing Englishman trying to sell the information. Guest starring Armand Assante, with David McCallum and Mark Harmon

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A sailor's body is discovered in a disused restaurant, and his death is initially ascribed to an accidental drug overdose. However, Abby discovers a message written in blood on a laminated card found at the scene and realises he was murdered. Meanwhile, Jimmy continues to pursue a relationship with Agent Michelle Lee

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A nuclear power plant inspector suffers radiation poisoning, forcing the team to consider the possibility that a foreign power deliberately targeted him. As the others investigate, Ziva spends time with the ailing victim - and begins to realise she is developing feelings for him. Drama, guest starring Matthew Marsden, with Cote de Pablo

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A notorious radio DJ claims to have survived an attack by two men posing as chauffeurs. Fontana and Green are dubious at first, knowing he has a history of staging bogus assaults on himself, but the discovery that he is having an affair with a mobster's mistress prompts them to investigate further. However, proving the Mafia's involvement depends on a number of unreliable or unavailable witnesses. Dennis Farina and Jesse L Martin star

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A jeweller with ties to the Russian Mob is shot dead in the middle of Times Square. It emerges that he had been helping the authorities bring his associates to justice, giving the detectives some obvious suspects. However, another man injured in the gunfire is later identified as one of the two shooters, bringing his accomplice and then the dead man's wife under suspicion

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Detectives Fontana and Green investigate the murders of a group of heroin users in a raid on a drug den. The prime suspect is a warlord who aided American forces in Afghanistan and claims diplomatic immunity - but McCoy and Southerlyn refuse to be swayed in their attempts to prosecute. Drama, starring Dennis Farina, Jesse L Martin, Sam Waterston and Elisabeth Rohm

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Paramedics become suspicious about a baby's death, calling in Briscoe and Curtis, who discover the parents adopted the child from an illegal Russian ring. The case takes on another dimension altogether when it transpires that the crooks specialise in placing terminally ill infants with unsuspecting families. Starring Jerry Orbach and Benjamin Bratt

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: McCoy and Carmichael have the unenviable task of prosecuting three police officers with a racially motivated hate crime that threatens to cause uproar in the city. Police drama, starring Sam Waterston and Angie Harmon

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A narcotics detective plans a major drugs sting but makes the mistake of illegally using a teenager as bait - with fatal consequences. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Benjamin Bratt

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The unit is called to examine the mysterious death of a sailor serving on a research vessel engaged in a top-secret mission. The ship proves to have been abandoned by its crew, and Ducky discovers the victim died from a highly contagious virus - putting everyone presently on board at risk. Drama, starring David McCallum, Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Lauren Holly

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A childhood friend of Gibbs' dead daughter is stalked by a marine who recently returned from Iraq, and asks the agent for help. Memories of his murdered family lead him to make the case a priority, but he acts on his initiative and leaves HQ without his badge, making DiNozzo fear he is risking his job for a personal vendetta. Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly star

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A taxi driver and an admiral working at the Pentagon are found executed by the side of a road, but the agents have trouble ascertaining a motive - until they uncover links to a woman searching for her missing husband, a political refugee from Africa. Meanwhile, McGee makes a discovery about his new girlfriend. Starring Sean Murray, Michael Weatherly and Mark Harmon

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny enters New York's Hasidic community to investigate the murder of the man recently appointed its leader - only to find the victim led a complicated personal life. Jamie arrests the former mayor's daughter for smoking drugs in public, and her bad attitude leaves Erin unable to help her, while Henry upsets Frank by revealing a family secret. Police drama, starring Donnie Wahlberg, Tom Selleck and Bridget Moynahan

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The team hunt for a predator who uses a date-rape drug that leaves no evidence. Meanwhile, Rollins receives some good news

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: As Carisi begins the long-anticipated trial of Sir Toby Moore, the unit faces setbacks in several other cases

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Petty officer Kyle Friedgen is accused of killing his ex-girlfriend, but while his case is dismissed due to a mishandled warrant, his life and reputation are marred by suspicion that he got away with murder. Determined to clear his name in full, Friedgen volunteers to be court-martialled, on the condition that the NCIS team conducts its own investigation. Meanwhile, Bishop and Jake discuss their marital problems. Naval crime drama, starring Emily Wickersham, with Jamie Bamber

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The two Marine brothers of a sailor battling leukaemia are killed in the line of duty, and to spare the servicemen's family further grief, the secretary of the US Navy seeks the NCIS team's help in locating a suitable bone marrow donor. Meanwhile, Bishop returns home to Oklahoma for Thanksgiving. Military crime drama, starring Emily Wickersham

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Ducky is assaulted by a man who claims to have previously undisclosed information about his half-brother, who died decades ago. While his NCIS colleagues traces the attacker's whereabouts, Dr Mallard recalls the emotional final days he spent with his sibling. Elsewhere, as the holiday season approaches, Bishop and Jake discuss the future of their relationship. Naval crime drama, starring David McCallum

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The first instalment of a two-part crossover with NCIS: New Orleans sees the Washington, DC team co-operating with their colleagues from the Big Easy to investigate a spate of lethal poisonings on board a New Orleans-to-DC flight. All the evidence seems to point to missing chef Luca, who happens to be Abby's brother, so the two investigative services join forces to locate him, and find out why a private tech firm seems to have been targetted by the killer. Naval crime drama, guest starring Scott Bakula

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Met Police helicopter India 99 is called to help rescue a woman who jumped into the Thames near the Palace of Westminster, as well as her two daughters, who leapt in after her. Elsewhere, the helicopter team coordinates a risky game of cat-and-mouse as police chase a group of graffiti artists across live train tracks in a patch of industrial wasteland in Battersea. The episode also looks at the case of the Hounslow Slasher, a man who in 2012 randomly attacked lone women while they were travelling home at night. Nick Wallis presents

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Fantasy Homes by the Sea
programme.desc: Jenni Falconer helps a Sheffield couple find a permanent seaside home in the popular Turkish resort of Cesme

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping Feature. Your one-stop-shop for all things cruise; bringing you the hottest destinations, ground-breaking ships and the latest deals to ensure your next cruise is your greatest one

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: At a Cornish castle, Drew Pritchard digs out beach buckets and toy trucks. Later, his friend Stuart sells off his renowned collection of car memorabilia - and Drew has first dibs

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a Devon mansion and takes home the worst chair he has ever bought and, at a lace factory in Scotland, literally goes home with the kitchen sink

programme.title: The Edinburgh Auction House
programme.desc: Sybelle uncovers her biggest ever haul of Royal Albert china. Plus, she helps a man with memory loss learn the true value of his rare whisky collection

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Road Trip debutant and dealer Stephanie Connell and auctioneer Charlie Ross travel around Kent looking for items of interest, before heading to an auction in Greenwich, London

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades searches for three items he can rework to reveal their true potential. To help him on his quest, he enlists woodworker Ollie Allen and upholsterer Sharon O'Connor. Ollie has his hands full with a rickety old shelving unit, while Sharon needs to come up with a bright idea for a pair of garden chairs. Jay himself attempts to transform an unwanted side table

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Scarlette Douglas helps Martyn and Anne Golesworthy find a holiday home on the Greek island of Naxos, which holds a special place in their hearts as the place they got married

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: The story of 30-year-old Joe, who must find the strength to face his past after losing his job and ending up mostly housebound

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: Deborah is after an off-the-shoulder, glamorous gown, but her entourage has conflicting opinions. Meanwhile, Dahlia's mother thinks that she should opt for a princess dress

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: Stubborn Sophie knows just what she wants, and bride Emma clashes with her friend over her dress choice

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.desc: Officers investigate when a Labrador is accused of biting two men, and wildlife experts fight to save the life of an injured owl

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: The North West Ambulance crews are being kept busy by a repeat caller who moves around Manchester's canals on his barge. Scott and Ana are the first to track him down and must remain patient in the face of his frustrating behaviour. Pragna and Amy are dispatched to a man threatening suicide, and Sarah and Alan treat a baby burnt by a cup of tea, before the normal routine of the night is interrupted by multiple calls reporting a serious incident near the Trafford Centre

programme.title: The Edinburgh Auction House
programme.desc: Sybelle heads to a Scottish island home packed with four generations of heirlooms, and hopes are high when the team discover a rare gold coin

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: The antiques challenge reaches south Wales, where Stephanie Connell plays skittles and Charlie Ross gets vertigo, before they learn who has won at auction in Worcestershire

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Stephanie Connell and Charlie Ross browse for items of interest - and potential value - around Leicestershire, Northamptonshire and Rutland. programme.desc: UFOs cruise by a cruise ship, a friendly spirit puts on a show for paranormal investigators, and a shadow figure stalks a woman through a forest

programme.title: Celebrity Help! My House Is Haunted
programme.desc: A regrettable graveyard photoshoot leaves Marnie with a dark attachment. The team need to act quickly to rid her of the evil spirit before it's too late
